title: Head of IT operations
description:
Apotea is Sweden’s leading online pharmacy, committed to making healthcare accessible and efficient for everyone. Our IT Operations team is the backbone of our daily business, ensuring that our systems are stable, secure, and continuously improving to support a fast-growing organization. We are now looking for a
 **Head of IT Operations** 
 – a hands-on leader with a passion for action, efficiency, and people.
   

  

 This role is both strategic and operational. You will
 **own the development and maintenance of Apotea’s IT operations** 
 , drive improvements, and ensure we keep moving toward greater scalability and efficiency. As a leader, you’ll manage and grow the IT operations team, fostering collaboration across functions to align technology initiatives with Apotea’s business goals.
   

  

**Your Role As Head Of IT Operations At Apotea**
* Lead and own IT operations – ensure stability, security, and performance of Apotea’s current systems and infrastructure.
* Drive improvements and efficiency – identify bottlenecks, implement smarter ways of working, and champion automation where it adds value.
* Plan strategically – align IT operations with Apotea’s business roadmap and growth, ensuring the right systems and capacity are in place.
* Solve problems at the core – act as a hands-on problem solver, balancing daily operations with forward-looking development.
* Foster collaboration – work cross-functionally with product, logistics, and business teams to ensure IT is a driver, not a bottleneck.
* Lead the team – manage IT operations staff, mentor team members, and create a culture of accountability and action.


**Who You Are**
 We’re looking for a Head of IT Operations who thrives in a fast-paced environment and knows how to balance daily execution with long-term strategy.
   

  

**You’re a PEOPLE & PROBLEM Person Who**
* Loves solving complex challenges while keeping a positive, pragmatic mindset.
* Communicates clearly and creates trust across teams and stakeholders.
* Understands the value of strong processes but isn’t afraid to roll up your sleeves when needed.


**You’re a STRATEGIC DOER Who**
* Knows how to plan for both today’s stability and tomorrow’s growth.
* Pushes for efficiency, automation, and smarter ways of working.
* Sees technology as a tool to unlock business value, not just a support function.


**What Apotea Offers You**
* The chance to lead and shape IT operations in Sweden’s largest online pharmacy.
* Join a flat, agile organization with minimal bureaucracy.
* Be part of an inclusive culture with collaboration at its core.
* Drive meaningful impact on millions of customers with reliable systems and fast deliveries.
* Career development opportunities through leadership, training, and industry exposure.
* Work for a stable, future-focused company with a meaningful mission to improve healthcare accessibility.


**About Apotea**
 Apotea.se is Sweden’s largest online pharmacy, with the country’s broadest range of over 32,000 non-prescription items and over 19,000 prescription drugs for humans and animals. Recognized as Sweden’s most sustainable e-commerce company (Sustainable Brand Index 2021), we simplify everyday life for our customers with fast deliveries and expert advice. In 2024, Apotea reached a turnover of SEK 6.5 billion and currently employs about 1,000 people across Stockholm, Lidingö, and Morgongåva.
   

  

 Apotea is an inclusive employer that values diversity. We welcome all applicants and strive to create a work environment where people, regardless of background, gender, age, religion, or disability, can thrive and grow.
   

  

**Recruitment Process**
* Apply
* Interview: Screening
* Interview: Technical & Leadership Capabilities
* Interview: Culture Fit
* Background Check: As a pharmacy, we always conduct a background check
* Offer Presented


**Location:** 
 Sveavägen 168, Stockholm, Sweden
   

  

**Reports to:** 
 CTO/CIO
   

  

**Application**
 Do not hesitate to send in your application already today. For more information or questions, visit our career page or contact us at jobb@apotea.se. We do not accept applications via email.
   

  

 🔗 LinkedIn
   

  

 📸 Instagram
   

  

**Join Us and Make a Difference – we hope you want to be part of our team!**
 Submit your application today—interviews are conducted on an ongoing basis, and the position may be filled immediately. Start date by agreement.
   

  

 Welcome to Apotea – where technology meets health and creates magic!
   

  

 Apotea är Sveriges största nätapotek med fokus på hållbarhet och snabba leveranser. Vår logistik är hjärtat i verksamheten, och vi har som mål att bli Nordens största apotek och Sveriges mest hållbara företag. Tillsammans med våra kunder har vi samlat in över 100 miljoner kronor till välgörenhet, och vi fortsätter att växa varje år – med våra medarbetare som den drivande kraften bakom framgången.

title: IT-tekniker med eget ansvar till Ersta diakoni
description:
**Om arbetsplatsen**
 Ersta diakoni är Sveriges största idéburna aktör inom vård och omsorg. Vi bedriver sjukvård, socialt arbete, forskning och utbildning, professionellt och utan vinstsyfte.
   

  

 Ersta diakoni är Sveriges största idéburna aktör inom vård och omsorg. Vår IT-avdelning är en möjliggörare för hela verksamheten och servicedesk är det självklara navet för alla IT-frågor.
   

  

 Idag är vi ett engagerat team med 17 kollegor som stöttar, utvecklar och förbättrar IT-miljön för hela organisationen.
   

  

 Hos oss får du både utvecklas i din roll och vara med och utveckla hela vårt arbetssätt!
   

  

 Som medarbetare hos oss erbjuder vi en rad förmåner som vi hoppas ska ge dig förutsättningar att trivas på jobbet och ha en givande fritid.
   

  

**Om rollen**
 Det här är en roll för dig som vill ha eget teknikansvar och driva utvecklingen framåt – inte bara lösa tickets. Du blir en viktig “second line”-resurs som stöttar servicedesken och tar vid när frågorna blir mer avancerade.
   

  

 Du kommer att:
   

  

* äga och ansvara för teknikområden (t.ex. M365, Windows-klienter, behörighets- och kontohantering, nätverk eller utskrifter)
* följa upp, fördjupa och lösa ärenden som eskaleras från servicedeskens första linje
* driva och delta i förbättrings- och utvecklingsprojekt inom IT-avdelningen
* samarbeta tvärfunktionellt för att skapa smartare, stabilare och mer proaktiva lösningar
* arbeta med installation, konfiguration och avancerad felsökning av mjukvara, operativsystem och kringutrustning
* använda verktyg som SCCM och Microsoft Intune för klienthantering, utrullningar och uppdateringar
* ta ansvar för att dokumentera processer och lösningar så att kunskap delas och kvaliteten säkras
* utbilda och stötta kollegor i servicedeskens första linje.


**Vem är du?**
 Du är självgående, analytisk och trivs bäst när du får äga, utveckla och fördjupa dig i teknik. Du har förmågan att ta ansvar för egna teknikområden, driver förbättringar och tycker om att både jobba självständigt och vara spindeln i nätet.
   

  

 Du gillar att ta tag i komplexa problem, hittar långsiktiga lösningar och är inte rädd för att ta egna initiativ. Samtidigt har du lätt för att förklara och lyfta andra i teamet – och du delar gärna med dig av din kompetens till kollegorna i servicedeskens första linje.
   

  

 Du delar Erstas värdegrund om att se hela människan och står för professionalism, tillit och hopp.
   

  

**Din erfarenhet**
 Vi söker dig som har gedigen erfarenhet av IT-support där du tagit ansvar för egna teknikområden. För att lyckas i rollen behöver du ha:
   

  

* djup kunskap inom Microsoft 365/Office 365 och Windows-klienter
* erfarenhet av SCCM och Microsoft Intune för klienthantering, programdistribution och policyadministration
* god erfarenhet av ärendehanteringssystem och strukturerad dokumentation
* vana att arbeta med användar- och behörighetsadministration i Active Directory
* erfarenhet av att arbeta projektbaserat och driva förändringsarbete inom IT
* förmåga att lyfta och utbilda andra i teamet


 Vi ser positivt på om du har:
   

  

* eftergymnasial IT-utbildning eller motsvarande erfarenhet
* erfarenhet från hälso- och sjukvårdsmiljö
* fördjupad kompetens inom nätverk, utskriftshantering och Microsoft 365 Admin Center, avancerad felsökning i Windows och molnbaserade plattformar.


**Övrigt om rekryteringen**
 Urval sker löpande och tjänsten kan komma att tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdag.
   

  

 Vi tillämpar provanställning som standard.
   

  

 Kontaktperson: Robert Rangdag, IT-Supportchef, Tjänsteägare Klient och identitet, robert.rangdag@erstadiakoni.se
   

  

 Facklig kontaktperson: Fiona Cameron, SACO, Fiona.cameron@erstadiakoni.se
   

  

 Sista ansökningsdag: 2025-08-31
   

  

*Observera att vi inte tar emot ansökningar via e-post.*
 Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!

title: Project Manager - Marketing
description:
**Job Description**
 WHAT YOU’LL DO
   

  

 As Project Manager in our Marketing department, you’ll be responsible for leading and driving both global and local, strategic marketing campaigns. Your responsibilities span from concept to completion, ensuring the campaigns align with brand direction, business goals, and audience insights.
   

  

 → Translate campaign briefs from Market Lead and Planner into actionable strategies and define goals, KPIs, and success metrics.
   

  

 → Coordinate cross-functional teams across several H&M channels, such as; Social Media, PR, Brand Experience, and Creative Production to ensure seamless execution.
   

  

 → Align campaign timelines and milestones with production planning, proactively manage risks, and ensure timely delivery.
   

  

 → Manage campaign budgets with a cost-conscious mindset. Make sure the budgets are used for maximum ROI and identify synergies across projects to maximize impact.
   

  

 → Track campaign performance, document learnings, and share insights to continuously improve future campaigns.
   

  

 → Act as the main point of contact for internal stakeholders and external partners, ensuring transparent communication throughout the campaign lifecycle.
   

  

**Who You’ll Work With**
 You’ll report to the Creative Production Operation Manager and work closely with internal teams across Marketing.
   

  

**Qualifications**
 WHO YOU ARE
   

  

 We are looking for people with…
   

  

 → Proven experience in strategic project management within marketing or brand environments, preferably on a global scale.
   

  

 → Deep understanding of the marketing ecosystem and landscape.
   

  

 → Passion for fashion and a deep understanding and curiosity of global trends and communities.
   

  

 → Strong leadership skills, excellent stakeholder management, and cross-functional collaboration skills.
   

  

 And people who are…
   

  

 → Highly organized, proactive, curious, humble and comfortable working in fast-paced, creative settings.
   

  

 → Analytical, strategic and results-driven, with a passion for delivering impactful campaigns and driving continuous improvement.
   

  

 → Wants to genuine passion for marketing and fashion
   

  

**Additional Information**
 WHO WE ARE
   

  

 H&M is a global company of strong fashion brands and ventures. Our goal is to prove that there is no compromise between exceptional design, affordable prices, and sustainable solutions. We want to liberate fashion for the many, and our customers are at the heart of every decision we make.
   

  

 We are made up of thousands of passionate and talented colleagues united by our shared culture and values. Together, we want to use our power, our scale, and our knowledge to push the fashion industry towards a more inclusive and sustainable future.
   

  

 WHY YOU’LL LOVE WORKING HERE
   

  

 At H&M, we are proud to be a vibrant and welcoming company. We offer our employees attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe.
   

  

 → A creative and collaborative environment where your ideas and leadership will shape global campaigns.
   

  

 → Opportunities to grow, learn, and influence the future of marketing at H&M.
   

  

 JOIN US
   

  

 Our uniqueness comes from a combination of many things – our inclusive and collaborative culture, our strong values, and opportunities for growth. But most of all, it’s our people who make us who we are.
   

  

 Take the next step in your career together with us. The journey starts here.
   

  

*We are committed to a recruitment process that is fair, equitable, and based on competency. We therefore kindly ask you to not attach a cover letter in your application.*

title: Business Analyst - Technical
description:
Title: Business Analyst to bank Payment Execution
 



  





 Description: Would you like to be a part of a team that maintain and take care of some of bank’s core payment systems?
 



 In bank you have the opportunity to:
 



  





 • Maintain services & functionality within the payments area that is currently undergoing its largest transformation in 60 years
 



 • Be part of a cross functional agile team in the Payment Execution Agile Release Train that uses SAFe and together plan the work, break down the backlog and prioritize the features
 



 • Act as a role model and take responsibility for all typical BA activities. E.g. analysis of product owner priorities, gaps and impacts, analysis of rule book changes, analysis of system processes and solutions, break-down of features, preparation, verification & anchoring of backlog items, requirement gathering, writing user stories and acceptance criteria, testing and quality assurance of the delivered functionality, maintenance and incident handling.
 



 What is needed in this role:
 



 • Experience within the Payments Domain for example file-based payments, SEPA/RIX or SWIFT/CBPR+
 



 • Experience from ongoing market initiatives such as migration of RIXINST, ISO20022 or RIXRTGS
 



 • Experience of maintenance and incident handling
 



 • Experience from database technologies such as SQL, IBM DB1/2 or Oracle DB is helpful
 



 • Be practical, driven, organized and an analytical problem solver with a passion for technology and financial solutions
 



 • Have knowledge of methods and tools used in business analysis
 



 • Be a team player with good collaboration and communication skills – listen, ask questions, build trust – and experience from agile ways of working, e.g. SAFe
 



 • Ability to be a bridge the gap between IT and business stakeholders to facilitate dialogue in the team and with external/internal stakeholders
 



 • An interest in details and understanding of the end-to-end process and result
 



 • Good writing, visualization and documentation skills

title: Senior  IT-arkitekt
description:
Vi har nu ett nytt behov och söker därför en konsultkollega med nedan kvalifikationer. Tjänsten är en del av vår konsultverksamhet vilket innebär att du blir anställd av oss och arbetar hos kund alt. interna projekt och åtaganden.
   

  

**Jobbeskrivning**
 Huvudsakliga uppgifter är att ta fram en plan för de utvecklingsaktiviteter och förändringar (roadmap) som man ser behöver utföras framåt, samt ge input utifrån omvärldsbevakning och tidigare erfarenhet till den roadmapen.
   

  

 Andra arbetsuppgifter är att guida vår tjänstearkitekt för Servicenow och stötta i uppgifter som att skriva beslutsunderlag, arkitekturdokumentation osv.
   

  

**Din profil (Skall krav)**
* Minst 8 års erfarenhet av arkitekturarbete inom Servicenow
* Certifiering eller dokumenterad utbildning inom It-arkitektur
* Flerårig aktuell och relevant arbetslivserfarenhet av att leda och stötta andra arkitekter och team i arkitekturella förändringar


**Meriterande**
* Flerårig aktuell och relevant arbetslivserfarenhet av It-arkitekturarbete inom komplexa It-organisationer, som tex. myndighet eller annan stor organisation.


**Sista ansökningdatum:** 
 26-08-2025
   

  

**Om Deploja**
 Vi sysselsätter idag erfarna konsulter, inom bl.a. Systemutveckling, Test, Arkitektur, IT-Projektledning, IT-Säkerhet.
   

  

 Att jobba på Deploja är något helt annat än att arbeta på ett vanligt konsultbolag – och det är vi riktigt stolta över. Vad är det då som gör oss unika?
   

  

 Vi erbjuder helt enkelt mer än bara hög lön och större frihet, det är bara början. Hos oss hittar du den arbetsmiljö och de möjligheter du förtjänar. Välkommen till Deploja, där gräset faktiskt är grönare!
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**
 🚀 Spännande uppdrag hos våra många kunder. Vi fokuserar på långsiktiga uppdrag, vilket ger dig möjlighet att skapa värde för kunden samtidigt som du utvecklas själv.
   

  

 🌟 En trygg månadslön – tillsammans bestämmer vi en grundlön baserad på dina uppdrag.
   

  

 🚗 Tjänstebil – vi uppmuntrar dig att välja en elbil för en mer hållbar framtid.
   

  

 💼 Tjänstepension och stora möjligheter till löneväxling.
   

  

 🌴 Semester - Önskar du mer än 30 dagar semester, kanske 60 dagar?
   

  

 🏥 Privat sjukvårdsförsäkring, olycksfallsförsäkring och livförsäkring för ökad trygghet.
   

  

 📚 Kompetensutveckling – du får själv sätta din budget och välja vilka utbildningar du vill delta i.
   

  

 🕑 Livskvalitet - Har du kanske svårt att få ihop pusslet i vardagen och önskar arbeta lite mindre och ändå kunna tjäna lika mycket om inte mer?
   

  

* Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande, med hänsyn till höga arbetstrycket är det extra viktigt med en kort motivering för tjänsten som förklarar hur man möter kraven.

title: Experienced S/4 HANA Security and Control Consultants
description:
Deloitte is a leading global provider of Audit & Assurance, Tax & Legal, and Consultative Services. With more than 457,000 professionals in over 150 countries, we help our clients and society to solve complex problems and achieve ambitious goals. We are driven by one purpose: to make an impact that matters. To us, this means lasting results for our clients and their businesses, ideas and actions that contribute to a greater good. It also means empowering our people and supporting them in their growth journey.
   

  

  




**Job Description**

 Deloitte's Technology & Transformation practice helps organizations effectively measure and mitigate risk and make informed and intelligent risk decisions around business processes, technology and operations. Our Technology & Transformation team has grown significantly over the past five years.
   

  

  

  

 As part of our North and South Europe member firm, you will be joining our professional team delivering world-class advisory services across the Nordic region. Our inclusive culture forms the core of our firm – the reason why we can call Deloitte one of life’s greatest communities. We embrace and encourage authenticity and diversity of thought, as we understand that inclusion unleashes the power of our people – we understand that our diversity is a source of strength.
   

  

  





 You will be working on different projects in an international environment designing, implementing, upgrading and monitoring SAP authorization concepts. With the support of your team, you will guide the development of internal controls for our clients to achieve the required risk management level. Moreover, you will assist the client in setting up monitoring processes and tools to remain in total control of security in their SAP landscape and provide our clients with expert technical knowledge on SAP authorizations, good practice working methods and functional insight into the business drivers for Governance, Risk & Compliance (GRC) activities.
   

  

  





 You will play a key role on our team, collaborating with your team members to successfully deliver appropriate security solutions on multiple projects. We strive to create an environment where curiosity drives innovative solutions to our clients’ requirements.
   

  

  





 As we are expecting our local S/4 team to grow in coming years – you should be excited by the prospect of being part of building and developing the local business while still being closely connected and contributing to our community in the Nordics.
   

  

  




**Qualifications**

 As a skilled member of our S/4 and Controls Advisory team, we expect that you will be able to teach us something new, just as we are hoping to teach you something new. We are growing fast and are looking for strong consultants within a broad experience in the field of security and controls.
   

  

  





 You will essentially possess the following qualifications:
   

  

  




* You are an SAP security expert with 5+ years of experience from an advisory environment.
* You can design and implement best-practice SAP security blueprints, fit for the clients’ business frameworks. Essentially enabling technology to drive business transformations within Authorizations, Risk Management, Internal Controls, Information Security and Privacy.
* You are able to lead work for designing and implementing roles and access concepts, i.e. SAP Authorization Management and Hazardous Work Combinations (SoD).
* You have proven experience of implementing risk solutions in global companies using SAP solutions and the ability to assess business requirements, design solutions, produce functional analysis/technical documentation, and implement and test solutions.
* Security experience in S/4 HANA implementation and Fiori authorizations is a plus.
* You have experience of designing, configuring and implementing SAP GRC products, such as Access Control, Process Control and Business Integrity screening etc.
* You quickly understand the client environment and identify the client’s business requirements, building strong relationships.
* You have strong analytical skills combined with good communication and training skills.
* You can work independently, define targets and prioritize tasks in a complex and demanding environment.
* You can plan and execute a project to deliver a superior client experience. In addition, you can gain an in-depth knowledge of the client’s business and stay up-to-date on industry activities, marketplace trends, innovation efforts and leading practices.
* You are a team player who is committed, proactive, enthusiastic, flexible and eager to learn.
* You are willing to travel on a regular basis.


 To succeed in the role, you need to have an interest in both technical and organizational aspects of security, including ability to understand business contexts. As a consequence, you are able to communicate with stakeholders both from the business and technology/IT. You have excellent language skills in English and preferably also Swedish.
   

  

  

  

 You are keen to share your experiences, motivate your colleagues and help developing the team and business. You are a relationship-oriented person with a drive and desire to deliver top quality service to your clients. Finally, you are a highly-driven team player who enjoys developing the business, solving problems and likes to take on new challenges.
   

  

  

**Additional Information**

**How to apply**




 You apply online. We encourage you to apply as soon as possible, as we are screening applications continuously and interviewing on a rolling basis. Please submit your CV, cover letter and university grades as part of your application.
   

  

  

  

 As a qualitative part of Deloitte's recruitment process, our final candidates undergo a background check, to increase awareness of our future employees, secure the working environment for our employees and meet regulatory requirements. The background check process is carried out in collaboration with ToFindOut. https://tofindout.se/en/background-check/
   

  

  

  

**Questions**




 If you have any questions regarding the role, please contact Kateryna Krugliakova at kkrugliakova@deloitte.se. For questions regarding the application process, please contact Anna Cygnaeus, Talent Acquisition, at acygnaeus@deloitte.se.
   

  

  





**What impact will you make?**




 Every day, your work will make an impact that matters, while you thrive in a dynamic culture of inclusion, collaboration and high performance. We do not just aspire to make solutions. We wish to create an impact that makes a positive and crucial difference for the people around us, our clients and our society. Deloitte is where you’ll find unlimited opportunities to succeed and realize your full potential.

title: Datacenter Technician
description:
**Who are we?**
 Equinix is the world’s digital infrastructure company®, operating over 260 data centers across the globe. Digital leaders harness Equinix's trusted platform to bring together and interconnect foundational infrastructure at software speed. Equinix enables organizations to access all the right places, partners and possibilities to scale with agility, speed the launch of digital services, deliver world-class experiences and multiply their value, while supporting their sustainability goals.
   

  

 Joining our operations team means that you will be at the forefront of all we do, maintaining critical facilities infrastructure as part of a close-knit team delivering best-in-class service to our data center customers. We embrace diversity in thought and contribution and are committed to providing an equitable work environment that is foundational to our core values as a company and is vital to our success.
   

  

**Job Summary**
 Are you keen to develop skills in a data center environment? We are looking for applicants who are keen to learn and develop their career in our market-leading data centers in Stockholm.
   

  

 Equinix is the world's largest data center and colocation provider.
   

  

 Our three data centers in Stockholm provide more than 13,000 square meters of colocation space to over 175 companies locally and globally.
   

  

 At Equinix we look for dynamic, customer and team focused Data Center Technicians who thrive in a fast-paced environment. A career at Equinix means constant opportunities to learn new skills and grow in new directions. We look for people who are customer service driven and who pride themselves on their technical skills alongside their problem-solving skills and innovative approach.
   

  

 As a Data Center Technician, you will be part of a team that is fundamental to our Equinix Operations department. The team provides 24 hours, 365 days per year support to our customers and the data center by conducting circuit maintenance, installations and advanced testing. They are also responsible for the daily upkeep and operation readiness of Equinix’s data centers.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
 Installations
   

  

* Installs cages, cabinets, cable containments, cabinets and customer equipment
* Installs & modify Cold Aisle Containments to ensure optimal Airflow


 Cross Connects
   

  

* Installs/Tests/Modifies cross connects per SOPs and ensures proper cable management of: coax, fiber, twisted pair copper and intra-building cross connects
* Installs and tests advanced cross connects circuits (switched, multiplexed, etc.)
* Installs and test Data Center Link cross connects using Fluke and JDSU testers


 Ticket Management
   

  

* Determines work priorities from the ticket system queue (eg. Siebel) and ensures adherence to all commitment times


 Testing/Troubleshooting
   

  

* Conducts carrier circuit testing


 Documentation/Reporting
   

  

* Maintains detailed written records of all work activity


 Facility Upkeep
   

  

* Support Facility Engineers by performing visual inspections while reporting and resolving issues


 Projects
   

  

* Supports senior staff on large scale projects


 Training
   

  

* Completes all assigned training in a timely manner. Equinix have an in-depth Training and development program designed to help new employees adjust to the workplace successfully, plus on-the-job-training, which helps new starters obtain the knowledge and skills they need to complete their tasks through a systematic training program


 Customer Management
   

  

* Supports customer satisfaction through timely and precise order execution


**Qualifications**
 Essential
   

  

* Well-versed in both written and spoken English language
* Basic Computer skills – MS Office
* Experience in customer service
* Previous experience in a technical role
* Works in a shift rotation that includes day / night shifts / weekends / holidays


 Desirable
   

  

* Basic understanding of Swedish is a big plus (not a requirement)


 This is a great opportunity to join a company that is growing quickly and still manages to keep an authentic and humble environment where the company culture is at the heart of our success.
   

  

 Please take a look at our
 *'History, Culture and Future of Equinix'* 
 video on YouTube where we interviewed people from around the company and asked them why they like working for Equinix: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=uTejQmBMA1s&feature=youtu.be
   

  

 Equinix is committed to ensuring that our employment process is open to all individuals, including those with a disability. If you are a qualified candidate and need assistance or an accommodation, please let us know by completing this form.
   

  

 Equinix is an Equal Employment Opportunity and, in the U.S., an Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to unlawful consideration of race, color, religion, creed, national or ethnic origin, ancestry, place of birth, citizenship, sex, pregnancy / childbirth or related medical conditions, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital or domestic partnership status, age, veteran or military status, physical or mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, political / organizational affiliation, status as a victim or family member of a victim of crime or abuse, or any other status protected by applicable law.

title: Solutions Architect
company_industry: Information Services and IT Services and IT Consulting
description:
Solution Architect – Stockholm
 



  





 We’re looking for a business-oriented Solution Architect who can bridge the gap between business and tech. This is not just a technical role, it’s a chance to influence strategy, shape digitalization, and drive value creation across the organization.
 



  





 Responsibilities:
 


* Act as the bridge between IT and business, engaging stakeholders at all levels.
* Shape requirements processes and influence how IT systems deliver business value.
* Play a key role in modernization projects, including a full rebuild of the company’s digital platforms.
* Contribute strategically, with a mix of Solution Architect / Business Analyst / Enterprise Architect responsibilities.



  





 Technical Environment
 


* Microsoft stack: .NET6, Azure Cloud, Azure DevOps, SQL Server, REST APIs.
* No active coding – but you’ll need to be technically fluent and guide architectural decisions.



  





 Requirements:
 


* Experienced with Microsoft / Azure architectures and enterprise-scale environments.
* Strong communicator who can collaborate across departments and influence decisions.
* Strategic thinker – not just a technical architect but a true business enabler.
* Comfortable in complex organizations (large companies, government, or consulting backgrounds).



  





 Why join:
 


* Be part of a mission-driven organization shaping the future through digital transformation.
* Work with both national and international stakeholders.
* Inclusive culture with a 65% female workforce and strong focus on collaboration.
* High impact role during a time of major modernization and growth.



  





 Key points:
 



 📍 Location: Stockholm (Torsplan)
 



 💼 Type: Permanent
 



 🕒 Flexibility: Hybrid (2–3 days in the office, 2–3 days remote.)

title: Senior Infrastructure Engineering
description:
Vi har nu ett nytt behov och söker därför en konsultkollega med nedan kvalifikationer. Tjänsten är en del av vår konsultverksamhet vilket innebär att du blir anställd av oss och arbetar hos kund alt. interna projekt och åtaganden.
   

  

**Jobbeskrivning**
* Leverera klient- och servertjänster och vara en del i drift- och supportteamet
* Patchhantering och uppgradering av klient- och servermiljön
* Utveckla script och arbeta med automationsverktyg för effektivisering av arbetssätt
* Service development kopplat till infrastruktursystem
* Säkerställa att de säkerhetskrav som finns uppfylls
* Aktivt delta i teknikförbättringsarbete
* Driva och dokumentera arbetet enligt rutiner och processer vi ska efterleva


**Din profil (Skall krav)**
 Vi söker dig som besitter mycket goda kunskaper inom Windows Server och Windows Client. För att lyckas i rollen ser vi att du har en utbildning inom IT eller motsvarande arbetslivserfarenhet. Du bör ha minst fem års dokumenterad arbetslivserfarenhet inom IT-området.
   

  

**Meriterande**
* Powershell
* VWware Horizon
* Djupa kunskaper i Active Directory
* Ansibel eller likvärdigt automationsverktyg
* MECM
* PKI / Smartcard
* Teradici
* VMware Vsphere
* OP5
* GIT
* MS SQL


**Sista ansökningdatum:** 
 27-08-2025
   

  

**Om Deploja**
 Vi sysselsätter idag erfarna konsulter, inom bl.a. Systemutveckling, Test, Arkitektur, IT-Projektledning, IT-Säkerhet.
   

  

 Att jobba på Deploja är något helt annat än att arbeta på ett vanligt konsultbolag – och det är vi riktigt stolta över. Vad är det då som gör oss unika?
   

  

 Vi erbjuder helt enkelt mer än bara hög lön och större frihet, det är bara början. Hos oss hittar du den arbetsmiljö och de möjligheter du förtjänar. Välkommen till Deploja, där gräset faktiskt är grönare!
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**
 🚀 Spännande uppdrag hos våra många kunder. Vi fokuserar på långsiktiga uppdrag, vilket ger dig möjlighet att skapa värde för kunden samtidigt som du utvecklas själv.
   

  

 🌟 En trygg månadslön – tillsammans bestämmer vi en grundlön baserad på dina uppdrag.
   

  

 🚗 Tjänstebil – vi uppmuntrar dig att välja en elbil för en mer hållbar framtid.
   

  

 💼 Tjänstepension och stora möjligheter till löneväxling.
   

  

 🌴 Semester - Önskar du mer än 30 dagar semester, kanske 60 dagar?
   

  

 🏥 Privat sjukvårdsförsäkring, olycksfallsförsäkring och livförsäkring för ökad trygghet.
   

  

 📚 Kompetensutveckling – du får själv sätta din budget och välja vilka utbildningar du vill delta i.
   

  

 🕑 Livskvalitet - Har du kanske svårt att få ihop pusslet i vardagen och önskar arbeta lite mindre och ändå kunna tjäna lika mycket om inte mer?
   

  

* Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande, med hänsyn till höga arbetstrycket är det extra viktigt med en kort motivering för tjänsten som förklarar hur man möter kraven.

title: Senior IT Analyst
description:
**Techster Solutions** 
 befinner i dagsläget sig i en spännande tillväxtfas och söker nu fler kollegor, inledningsvis dig med minst
 **5+** 
 års erfarenhet och som kan stärka teamet.
   

  

 Du kan förvänta dig en omväxlande miljö, dagarna kan se väldigt olika ut - men en sak är säkert, här får du använda dina kompetenser och sätter själv gränsen för hur mycket du vill utvecklas. Som ett kunskapsbolag är det viktigt för oss att våra specialister delar med sig av sin kompetens och får kollegorna att växa.
   

  

 Rollbeskrivning:
   

  

**We are looking for a Senior IT Analyst for our client in the financial industry**
**Job Description:**
* Collaborate with business stakeholders to understand and document business strategies(in alignment with the target picture to enable sustainable solutions).
* Eliciting functional and non-functional requirements by co operating with different stakeholders e.g. architects, developers, testers, business, legal.
* Translate business strategies into detailed technical requirements for the IT team.
* Securing requirements traceability during smooth end-to-end development.
* Being responsible for requirements documentation (inc. use cases) and quality improvement.
* Supporting testers and developers in the team and hub.
* Verify developed solutions by conducting test results.
* Provide insights to stakeholders on the effectiveness of implemented solutions.


**Required skills:**
* Experience in IT and/or business analysis
* Excellent written and spoken English communication skills, and familiar with international collaboration
* Experience of using Jira, Confluence.
* Experience or knowledge of API development, Data Mapping and Process Modelling
* Knowledge of the banking sector and payment domain.
* Practical knowledge of SQL, user interface prototyping and design
* Knowledge of Architecture diagrams like sequence diagrams.
* Solid technical knowledge for effective collaboration with developers.
* Proficiency with analysis tools and methodologies.


**Nice-to-have Knowledge And Experience**
* Familiarity with regulatory requirements in the banking sector.
* Practical knowledge of REST/SOAP API.
* Knowledge of PSD2,PSD3/PSR.


**Ansökan**
 Tror du att du är
 **Techster Solutions** 
 nästa stjärna? Tveka då inte att skicka in din ansökan redan nu. Urval sker löpande och tillträde sker enligt överenskommelse.
   

  

 Arbetsplats och kultur
   

  

 Vi är ett entreprenördrivet IT företag, med både produktkunskap och försäljning (Techster AB) och konsultativa tjänster (Techster Solutions AB). Det innebär att vi är mycket öppna för nya tekniska lösningar, kunskapsutbyte och ständigt lärande. Att ha roligt och samtidigt behålla den familjära andan utan hierarkier är lika viktigt.
   

  

 Vi vill skapa det konsultbolag som du alltid velat jobba för, men kanske inte hittat ännu. Redan idag har vi en blandning av seniora och yngre medarbetare, såväl som män och kvinnor. Det vill vi fortsätta att bygga på. Så välkommen med din ansökan!

title: IT-specialist
description:
Hacksaw Studios är ett snabbt växande techbolag med passion för att skapa mobilspel i världsklass. Vi växer snabbt och behöver nu förstärka vårt team med en intern IT-specialist som kan ta hand om vår kontors-IT och se till att allt fungerar smidigt för våra medarbetare.
   

  

 Vi letar efter dig som trivs med att hjälpa andra, har god koll på både Mac och PC och tycker att allt från datorbyggen till nätverk och kontorsutrustning är roligt. Du arbetar praktiskt med att installera, underhålla och felsöka samtidigt som du ger professionellt stöd till dina kollegor.
   

  

 OBS – Detta är en roll med placering på vårt kontor i centrala Stockholm. Vi arbetar heltid på kontoret och arbete hemifrån förekommer endast i undantagsfall.
   

  

 Vad du kommer att göra
   

  

* Sätta upp arbetsplatser – förbereda datorer och tillbehör, ansluta till nätverk och se till att nya medarbetare snabbt kommer igång.
* Installera och bygga datorer – hantera både Windows- och Mac-miljöer, uppgradera hårdvara och installera mjukvara.
* Hantera konton och accesser – administrera användarkonton, behörigheter och säkerhetsinställningar.
* Supportera kontorsutrustning – ge support för skrivare, bildskärmar, telefoner, videokonferensutrustning och annan teknik.
* Lösa IT-problem löpande – vara första kontakt för IT-relaterade frågor och proaktivt förbättra våra system och rutiner.


 Vi tror att du...
   

  

* Har några års erfarenhet inom IT-support eller liknande roll och är bekväm i både Mac- och Windows-miljöer.
* Gillar att bygga och optimera datorer och nätverk samt ser till att kontorsutrustning fungerar utan avbrott.
* Är trevlig, serviceinriktad, tillmötesgående och trivs med att hjälpa andra.
* Är noggrann, strukturerad och duktig på att dokumentera och följa upp ärenden.
* Tar eget ansvar, är aktiv och initiativrik – du ser vad som behöver göras och gör det.
* Kommunicerar obehindrat på svenska och engelska.


 Vad vi erbjuder
   

  

* Ett modernt, flexibelt och kreativt arbetsklimat i centrala Stockholm.
* En central roll där du bidrar direkt till att våra medarbetare kan göra sitt bästa arbete.
* Möjlighet att forma och utveckla vårt IT-stöd när bolaget växer.
* Arbete i ett passionerat team där idéer blir verklighet snabbt.


 Lönen för den här rollen är 30.000 kr per månad.

title: Junior Designer
description:
Acne Studios is a progressive luxury house and through collaboration and curiosity, we set high aspirations and strive for excellence. We value everyone’s contribution and embrace feedback to develop ourselves and others. We aim to minimise our environmental impact across all our operations and to address societal challenges in the way we conduct our business.
   

  

 As Junior Designer, based full-time in Stockholm and working from our Head Office you will be part of our Men´s Design team within our Product & Design department. You will work closely with the team, gaining hands-on experience and contributing to the development of our collections.
   

  

 CULTURE OF COLLABORATION
   

  

 We firmly believe that when you feel supported, included, and trusted, it enables you to enjoy your work and thrive in it. You will be a part of a team of colleagues with diverse roles and backgrounds, each with their unique skills and experiences.
   

  

 WHAT YOU WILL DO
   

  

 As Junior Designer your main contribution will be to assist in the design process, from making research & sketches, to creating 3D mock-ups or toiles, and more. You will report to the Head Designer of the Men´s Design team. You will play a vital role in creating strong collections by:
   

  

* Making research for the collection regarding shapes, materials and colours. This could be for seasonal concepts or carry-over programs
* Creating shapes and mock-ups to generate 3D concepts that can be applied to the collection, helping to translate design proposals into products
* Making sketches in Illustrator and creating photoshops to facilitate design decisions during the process
* Creating and updating seasonal overviews, inspiration boards and style boards
* Partnering with the product development team and following up on prototypes during development process
* Supporting the team to prepare for meetings and presentations


 WHO YOU ARE
   

  

 You have high aspirations and focus on details that create substantial impact. You enjoy working as a team and you embrace feedback to develop yourself and others. You are curious and thrive in a dynamic environment. Cooperation, respect, and clear communication are important, along with your ambition to learn and grow. If these qualities speak to you, we would love to have you on our team.
   

  

 Specific personal qualities for this role:
   

  

* Cultured, refined, inspiring and creative individual
* Flexible with the ability to work in a fast-paced environment
* Cooperative with a positive mindset
* Ability to take initiative and prioritize work tasks


 Specific experience and knowledge for this role:
   

  

* Academic degree from design and/or textile education
* Experience in working within a design studio for at least 1 year preferably within high-end brands
* Outstanding communication skills in written and spoken English
* Advanced Adobe skills
* Ability to think three-dimensionally and to visualize flat designs on the body


 What matters most to us is not whether you master all the listed knowledge and skills. We are dedicated to recognising the potential in each individual. We embrace diversity of people as well as ideas and viewpoints and encourage everyone's individual expression of their own identity.

title: Information Security Officer
description:
Almost 25 years ago, Nordnet redefined the financial world as the first digital bank in Europe. Now we are about to do it again with the aim of creating the next generation cloud based banking. We know that this requires great people, great teams and great technology.
   

  

 Do you want to join us and help build the new Nordnet?
   

  

**We are Nordnet’s security team**
 As Nordnet’s designated security team we handle everything from secure development to incident response and information security. Our philosophy is that we are more successful as a team than as individuals and we believe that security challenges are best addressed through collaboration, where different security professions come together. To make this work, every team member contributes and takes responsibility for the team's results. We also believe that working as a tight team allows us to have more fun at work!
   

  

**This is your role**
* Develop, implement and maintain Nordnet’s security awareness program.
* Focus on third-party risk management, including; Conducting security assessments and security due diligence reviews and; Collaborate with Procurement and Legal to incorporate security requirements into vendor contracts.
* Oversee and continuously improve the Security Service Desk.
* Participate in the development and review of physical security guidelines and procedures, including; Collaborate with Workplace Experience to plan and implement physical security controls.
* Assists with the implementation of new security regulations.
* Keep up to date with security threats and trends.


 You report to the Head of Security and will be located in Stockholm together with the rest of the team.
   

  

**This is you**
 You are experienced in information security principles, practices and frameworks (e.g. NIST Cyber Security Framework, ISO 27001).
   

  

 You are passionate about security awareness and fostering a strong security culture.
   

  

 You have strong communication skills (written and verbal) to create impactful awareness materials, articulate security requirements, and provide clear guidance.
   

  

 You can independently structure and drive your area of responsibility
   

  

 You are also interested in understanding and contributing to the physical security measures of the bank, recognizing their importance in protecting information assets.
   

  

 You understand that communication, collaboration and compromises are the key components of a successful security team. At the same time, you have a pragmatic mindset and smart approach to security risks. You realise that the objective is to achieve adequate security in relation to the risks, not that every risk must be eliminated.
   

  

 You are a driven coordinator who takes responsibility for the team's success. You’ll have a background in information security and have five or more years of solid experience working within the field. We prefer that you also have a background in the financial sector and a technical foundation, since we are a digital bank.
   

  

 You have the ability to communicate information security risk on a business level to management as well as the ability to communicate with techies. We also require that you speak and write English fluently; Swedish is not mandatory but definitely a plus.
   

  

**This is us**
 We offer you the opportunity to work in a great team within a friendly Nordic environment with a strong focus on innovation, product development and technology. We are currently building a world-class customer experience and have a vision to become the number one choice for savings and investments in the Nordic countries. Our ambitions are high and you will embark on a fast and challenging journey within a tight team of sharp and committed colleagues. At Nordnet, there is great potential for development and opportunities to redefine the financial world.
   

  

 We have 900 employees located in Stockholm, Oslo, Helsinki and Copenhagen.
   

  

 Visit us on: www.nordnetab.com
   

  

**Questions & applications**
 If you have questions, please contact Nordnet Talent Acquisition Partner Keri Bergström Käll, Keri.Bergstrom.Kall@nordnet.se.
   

  

 Please note that we only accept applications through our recruitment system, hence no email applications will be considered. We want to inform you that Nordnet conducts credit and background checks on the final candidate.

title: Data Privacy Manager
description:
**Job Title: Data Privacy Manager** 




  





**Experience: 6+ years** 




  





**Location - Sweden** 




  





**Job Role-** 




  





 We are looking for an experienced Data Privacy professional to join the highly regarded Privacy Team at HCLTech.
 



  





 The Group Manager-Privacy supports the Global Privacy Office in the effective management of the HCLTech’ s Privacy Compliance Framework and supporting corporate and business teams in maintaining high standards in data privacy consistent with HCLTech values and applicable data protection laws.
 



  





 The individual will be responsible for supporting and implementing all aspects of the global data protection compliance strategy and provision of advice and guidance to effectively mitigate data privacy risks.
 



  





 This role will involve regular interactions with all functions within the organization which undertake or influence the processing of personal data including HR, Information Security, Information Technology, Marketing, Business Teams, Risk & Compliance teams etc.
 



  




1. **Role and Responsibilities**



  




* Provide expert advice and guidance to employees and Corporate & Business teams across the regions in relation to data protection and privacy.
* Develop and maintain comprehensive internal data protection policies and procedures, consistent with regulatory requirements and wider HCLTech group strategy.
* Carry out PIA and PbD assessments for personal data processing activities.
* Undertake regular internal reviews for personal data handling processes to assess compliance with relevant laws and policies and identify compliance risks.
* Regularly monitor and report on changes in data protection obligations. Perform gap analysis in relation to new legislation, regulatory guidance and/or compliance frameworks, and oversee the implementation of applicable requirements across the business.
* Document action plans to address identified privacy risks and maintain an up-to-date privacy risk register.
* Lead, as required, and maintain cross-functional working groups to coordinate privacy efforts, including current projects and initiatives and regulatory awareness.
* Manage data subject rights requests and privacy-related complaints.
* Act as the point of contact for internal and external data protection audits
* Work with all key business areas, and support functions to ensure data privacy issues are considered at the outset of new projects, products, and initiatives.
* Handle personal data incidents and provide subject matter expertise to assess the impact of the incident and measures for mitigating the risk. Where applicable assist with reporting of confirmed breaches to concerned regulatory authorities and impacted data subjects
* Support the development and roll out of privacy training, communications, and awareness campaigns (both mandatory and targeted training) across the enterprise to reinforce privacy policies, procedures, and practices; and
* Support the Regional Privacy Officer(s) and the Chief Privacy Officer to meet Board, Committee, and other reporting requirements.



  





**Technical and Professional Skills** 




  




* A bachelor's or master's degree preferably in law, information security, computer science, or a related discipline.
* A deep understanding of global privacy laws (e.g., GDPR, LGPD, PIPL, CPRA, HIPAA,DPDP Act etc.)
* Professional certifications such as CIPP, CIPM, CIPT, CDPSE, DCPP etc.
* Between five and nine years of experience in a privacy/data protection role.
* Experience in managing data privacy issues in a global organization.
* Proficiency in assessing and mitigating data privacy risks as well as understanding risk management frameworks.
* Ability to manage and prioritize multiple projects, ensuring timely and successful completion while adhering to compliance standards.
* Ability to build and maintain effective relationships with key stakeholders, including stakeholder buy in of activity, findings, remediation, and outputs.
* Ability to effectively lead and manage a team of privacy professionals.
* Ability to work well individually as well as in collaboration.
* Excellent listening, verbal, and written communication skills.
* Excellent interpersonal and problem-solving skills and to builds relationships both internally and externally.
* Credibility, professionalism, and strong personal integrity.
* Understanding and appreciation of different cultural, business practices and attitudes, and



 strong attention to detail.
 



  





**Other requirements** 



* The candidate must within
 **Sweden** 
 or EU/EEA region and must have the appropriate work authorization to work in Sweden
* Language requirements – The professional should be fluent in Swedish, English (written and spoken). Knowledge of other languages is a plus.

title: IT-säkerhetsspecialister till Saab
company_industry: Defense and Space Manufacturing, Security and Investigations, and IT Services and IT Consulting
description:
*Vill du arbeta med IT-säkerhet och vara med att utveckla området på ett av Sveriges mest högteknologiska företag? IT-säkerhet är prioriterat, på ledningens agenda och avgörande för konkurrenskraft, förtroende och lönsamhet på en utmanande global marknad.*
 Din roll
   

  

 Saab söker specialister inom IT-säkerhet till affärsområde Surveillance. Affärsområde Surveillance är baserat på olika orter runt om i Sverige, placeringsort för den aktuella tjänsten är i Solna/Järfälla i Stockholm.
   

  

 Som IT-säkerhetsspecialist på Saab kommer du att arbeta i en internationell miljö där avancerade säkerhetshot, komplexa IT-miljöer och affärsprojekt av stor dignitet är en del av vardagen.
   

  

 I din roll kommer du att bistå verksamheten med att hantera externa och interna säkerhetskrav, hjälpa till att identifiera och förebygga säkerhetshot, samt stödja verksamheten med deras systematiska IT-säkerhetsarbete, inklusive riskbedömning och riskreducering. Du kommer även att vara en nyckelspelare i hanteringen av incidenter och i att öka säkerhetsmedvetenheten.
   

  

 Dina huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter kommer att vara:
   

  

* IT-säkerhet
* Riskhantering
* Hantering av kravefterlevnad
* Incidenthantering, inklusive incidentutredningar


*Vill du veta mer om Saab och fördelarna med att jobba hos oss? Läs vår* 
*personalfilosofi* 
*.*
 Din profil
   

  

 Krav på färdigheter:
   

  

* Universitets-/högskole-/yrkeshögskoleexamen och/eller motsvarande kompetens förvärvad genom arbetslivserfarenhet inom IT/Cybersäkerhet, nätverks-/systemadministration, informationssäkerhet, riskhantering eller liknande
* Kunskaper i, och erfarenhet av praktisk tillämpning av, informations-/cybersäkerhetsstandarder som ISO 27001 och/eller NIST 800-171 och/eller KSF (Försvarsmaktens krav på säkerhetsfunktioner)
* Förmåga att analysera hot och trender inom cybersäkerhet, och omsätta kunskaper i konkreta åtgärder
* Förståelse för IT-systemdesign
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med riskhantering inom IT-säkerhet
* Förmåga att kommunicera om säkerhetsrisker på ett effektivt sätt, både på svenska och engelska, och på såväl teknisk som strategisk nivå
* Effektiv problemlösningsförmåga och analytiska färdigheter


 Meriterande erfarenhet:
   

  

* Att arbeta med sårbarhetsskanning
* Ackreditering av IT-system
* Att arbeta med incidentutredningar
* Säkerhetsloggar och rapporter
* Statlig myndighet eller i ett globalt företag, inklusive förståelse för IT-säkerhetsrelaterade frågor i de olika affärsprocesserna
* Säkerhetsskydd och/eller signalskydd
* Ledarskap och/eller projektledning


 Personliga egenskaper är av största vikt, det är nödvändigt att du är pålitlig med stark etik och en hög personlig integritet. Det är viktigt att du har förmåga att bygga och vårda nätverk och goda relationer både inom och utanför din egen organisation. Du ska dessutom kunna arbeta självständigt och i team, alltid med fokus på affärs- och teamresultat. Det är också viktigt att du förstår behovet av balanserad säkerhet i en affärsdriven miljö.
   

  

 Befattningen kräver att du genomgår och godkänns enligt vid var tid gällande bestämmelser för säkerhetsskydd. För befattningar där Saab har krav på säkerhetsklassinplacering kan, i förekommande fall, medföra krav på visst medborgarskap.
   

  

 Vad du kommer att vara en del av
   

  

 Affärsområde Surveillance erbjuder effektiva lösningar för säkerhet, övervakning och beslutsstöd samt för hotdetektering och skydd, både för den militära och den civila domänen. Portföljen omfattar luftburen, markbaserad och marin radar, elektronisk krigföring, ledningssystem och C4I-lösningar med mera.
   

  

 Inom Saab Security är vår ambition att bli världsledande inom säkerhetsriskhantering, och att av andra säkerhetsexperter refereras till som det företag som har de bästa rutinerna på plats.
   

  

 Säkerhetsfunktionen inom affärsområde Surveillance är ett team som består av kompetenser som säkerhetschefer, IT- och informationssäkerhetsspecialister, personalsäkerhetsspecialister, specialister på fysiskt skydd och säkerhetsadministratörer. Du kommer att arbeta med alla våra affärsenheter och med våra verksamheter utanför Sverige.
   

  

 Vi är ett globalt företag som arbetar i ett internationellt sammanhang, vilket innebär att du kommer att resa både nationellt och internationellt. Du måste vara bekväm med att både tala och skriva på engelska.
   

  

 Observera att detta är en pågående rekrytering och att tjänsten kan komma att tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdag.
   

  

 Om du vill vara med och skapa och förnya samtidigt som du utvecklas i en utmanande teammiljö, kan Saab ha de perfekta förutsättningarna för dig att växa. Vi är stolta över vår omsorgsfulla miljö, där alla är olika men ändå delar samma mål – att hjälpa till att skydda människor.
   

  

 Läs mer om oss här

title: Graphic Designer
description:
Our mission is to rid the planet of fossil fuels. Since our start in 2014, we have helped avoid emissions equivalent to what 2.2 million gasoline-powered cars emit in a year!
   

  

 In the beginning, we only helped our customers with solar panels. Over the years, we have innovated new Energy Tech solutions based on their needs. Today, we are the company driving the industry forward, offering the most comprehensive solutions for everything related to energy in the home.
   

  

 So how will you contribute? We are currently undergoing a brand transformation – building our Energy Tech brand and communicating that we are much more than just solar panels. That’s why we’ve created an entirely new role within our Marketing team, where we’re looking for an experienced
 **Graphic Designer** 
 to help bring our brand to life and make sure our story resonates across all channels.
   

  

 Welcome to the Power Shift!
   

  

**The team**
 In our Marketing team, you will work closely with Madeleine (Media Manager), Jonathan (Head of Marketing Development), Gustav and Frida (CRM Managers), and Tomas (Content Manager). Your direct manager will be Sofia Brandberg (CMO). The team is growing, we’re looking for you and also a Marketing Analytics Specialist. Everyone is looking forward to welcoming you on board!
   

  

 Madeleine shares her experience of the team and the company:
   

  

*“We are a fantastic team with diverse skill sets, high engagement, strong drive, and great team spirit. In a growing company within the solar and energy industry – a thrilling rollercoaster where a lot is happening – the work becomes both fun and challenging. If you enjoy adapting to fast changes, taking initiative, and collaborating with colleagues across different areas, you will feel right at home at Svea Solar!”*
**Responsibilities**
 As a Graphic Designer at Svea Solar, you’re not just crafting visuals—you’re shaping the brand’s voice, energy, and presence across every touchpoint. You play a pivotal role in shaping the next chapter of our visual identity. This is a rare opportunity to leave your creative fingerprint on everything from campaigns to everyday assets, with the freedom to explore, experiment, and elevate. You’ll be the go-to creative force in the marketing team, collaborating across the company to bring our mission to life: to rid the planet from fossil fuels. Your work will help us stand out in a competitive market, inspire customers, and energize internal teams.
   

  

* Maintain and evolve Svea Solar’s visual identity and design system across all channels, ensuring both consistency and creative innovation.
* Design and produce high-quality visual assets for a variety of marketing initiatives, including digital advertising, social media, email campaigns, presentations, and print materials.
* Apply a commercial mindset to design—evaluate the performance of creative assets, draw insights from results, and continuously optimize for greater impact and effectiveness.
* Co-lead creative productions such as photo and video shoots in collaboration with the CMO and Content Manager.
* Translate creative briefs into compelling concepts in close partnership with Content Manager and Media Manager.
* Support internal communications and employer branding efforts with engaging and on-brand design solutions.
* Stay current with design trends, tools,best practices and AI in design to ensure Svea Solar’s brand remains fresh, relevant, and forward-thinking.


**Are we a match?**
*We are looking for you who…*
* Have proven expertise in graphic design, with at least a couple of years (or more) of experience, ideally in a fast-paced marketing or commercial environment.
* Are confident in developing and maintaining brand guidelines and visual identity systems, ensuring consistency across all channels and touchpoints.
* Are a versatile creator, able to produce both static and motion graphics across formats such as social media, advertising, email campaigns, print materials, and sales collateral.
* Are proficient in Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign, After Effects) and Figma, and curious about exploring AI tools for scalable content creation.
* Have relevant education in graphic design.
* Communicate fluently in English (written and spoken); Swedish is a plus.


**Personal Qualifications**
* Can manage multiple projects independently while delivering high-quality work on time.
* Are a true team player who spreads positive energy, shares ideas openly, and contributes to a fun, collaborative work culture—both within the team and across functions.
* Think commercially, using data and insights (e.g., A/B testing) to optimize your design work and adapt visual storytelling based on performance.


**Nice-to-have**
* Possess skills in filming, photography, and editing.
* Can visualize data in an engaging and easy-to-understand way.


 The list might look long, but no one is perfect in every category. If you see yourself in some of it – apply! 😊 At Svea Solar, you can Grow as we grow – we’ll help you develop new skills along the way.
   

  

 Diversity & Inclusion
   

  

 We believe that diversity and different perspectives fuel the creativity needed to transform the energy industry. We value a balanced gender mix and aim to hire people from all kinds of backgrounds to better represent society and our customers. That’s why all candidates are assessed equally – with structured questions and Alva Labs’ assessments as part of the process.
   

  

 Become a Power Shifter
   

  

 🌏 Make a real impact – climate change won’t wait.
   

  

 🌱 Face exciting challenges and grow your career.
   

  

 🌞 Join a workplace where great leadership, kindness, humor, and learning from mistakes are part of the culture.
   

  

 Our process
   

  

* No cover letter needed.
* Apply with LinkedIn = no CV needed.
* We start reviewing applications right away
* Final candidates will undergo a background check
* Assessments in Alva Labs are part of the process – because diversity is key!


 Here you can find a guide on our recruitment process
   

  

 ☀ We can’t wait to see your application!

title: Graphic Designer
description:
Our mission is to rid the planet of fossil fuels. Since our start in 2014, we have helped avoid emissions equivalent to what 2.2 million gasoline-powered cars emit in a year!
   

  

 In the beginning, we only helped our customers with solar panels. Over the years, we have innovated new Energy Tech solutions based on their needs. Today, we are the company driving the industry forward, offering the most comprehensive solutions for everything related to energy in the home.
   

  

 So how will you contribute? We are currently undergoing a brand transformation – building our Energy Tech brand and communicating that we are much more than just solar panels. That’s why we’ve created an entirely new role within our Marketing team, where we’re looking for an experienced
 **Graphic Designer** 
 to help bring our brand to life and make sure our story resonates across all channels.
   

  

 Welcome to the Power Shift!
   

  

**The team**
 In our Marketing team, you will work closely with Madeleine (Media Manager), Jonathan (Head of Marketing Development), Gustav and Frida (CRM Managers), and Tomas (Content Manager). Your direct manager will be Sofia Brandberg (CMO). The team is growing, we’re looking for you and also a Marketing Analytics Specialist. Everyone is looking forward to welcoming you on board!
   

  

 Madeleine shares her experience of the team and the company:
   

  

*“We are a fantastic team with diverse skill sets, high engagement, strong drive, and great team spirit. In a growing company within the solar and energy industry – a thrilling rollercoaster where a lot is happening – the work becomes both fun and challenging. If you enjoy adapting to fast changes, taking initiative, and collaborating with colleagues across different areas, you will feel right at home at Svea Solar!”*
**Responsibilities**
 As a Graphic Designer at Svea Solar, you’re not just crafting visuals—you’re shaping the brand’s voice, energy, and presence across every touchpoint. You play a pivotal role in shaping the next chapter of our visual identity. This is a rare opportunity to leave your creative fingerprint on everything from campaigns to everyday assets, with the freedom to explore, experiment, and elevate. You’ll be the go-to creative force in the marketing team, collaborating across the company to bring our mission to life: to rid the planet from fossil fuels. Your work will help us stand out in a competitive market, inspire customers, and energize internal teams.
   

  

* Maintain and evolve Svea Solar’s visual identity and design system across all channels, ensuring both consistency and creative innovation.
* Design and produce high-quality visual assets for a variety of marketing initiatives, including digital advertising, social media, email campaigns, presentations, and print materials.
* Apply a commercial mindset to design—evaluate the performance of creative assets, draw insights from results, and continuously optimize for greater impact and effectiveness.
* Co-lead creative productions such as photo and video shoots in collaboration with the CMO and Content Manager.
* Translate creative briefs into compelling concepts in close partnership with Content Manager and Media Manager.
* Support internal communications and employer branding efforts with engaging and on-brand design solutions.
* Stay current with design trends, tools,best practices and AI in design to ensure Svea Solar’s brand remains fresh, relevant, and forward-thinking.


**Are we a match?**
*We are looking for you who…*
* Have proven expertise in graphic design, with at least a couple of years (or more) of experience, ideally in a fast-paced marketing or commercial environment.
* Are confident in developing and maintaining brand guidelines and visual identity systems, ensuring consistency across all channels and touchpoints.
* Are a versatile creator, able to produce both static and motion graphics across formats such as social media, advertising, email campaigns, print materials, and sales collateral.
* Are proficient in Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign, After Effects) and Figma, and curious about exploring AI tools for scalable content creation.
* Have relevant education in graphic design.
* Communicate fluently in English (written and spoken); Swedish is a plus.


**Personal qualifications:**
* Can manage multiple projects independently while delivering high-quality work on time.
* Are a true team player who spreads positive energy, shares ideas openly, and contributes to a fun, collaborative work culture—both within the team and across functions.
* Think commercially, using data and insights (e.g., A/B testing) to optimize your design work and adapt visual storytelling based on performance.


**Nice-to-have:**
* Possess skills in filming, photography, and editing.
* Can visualize data in an engaging and easy-to-understand way.


 The list might look long, but no one is perfect in every category. If you see yourself in some of it – apply! 😊 At Svea Solar, you can Grow as we grow – we’ll help you develop new skills along the way.
   

  

 Diversity & Inclusion
   

  

 We believe that diversity and different perspectives fuel the creativity needed to transform the energy industry. We value a balanced gender mix and aim to hire people from all kinds of backgrounds to better represent society and our customers.
