title: Security Engineer
description:
*Nordnet redefined the financial world as the first digital bank in Europe. Now we are about to do it again and the aim is to create the next generation of bank, in the cloud. We know that this requires great people, great teams, and great technology. Do you want to join us and build the new Nordnet?*
**In brief**
 At Nordnet we want to democratize savings and investments by giving our customers access to the best tools and information whether you are a professional investor or a small saver. With modern technologies and speed of delivery, we are building the next generation investment platform.
   

  

**This is part of the role**
 Nordnet is a company with tech as the primary focus. In our agile and autonomous teams, you will be working with engaged colleagues that love to share their knowledge. As a cloud security engineer, you will drive automation and integrate DevSecOps into our cloud-based platform by embedding security in CI/CD pipelines, enhancing infrastructure security and ensuring secure software development practices.
   

  

**As a Security Engineer, You Will**
* Coordinate penetration testing efforts and track remediations.
* Conduct threat modelling sessions, secure code review and vulnerability assessments.
* Develop and enforce cloud and infrastructure as code (IaC) security policies.
* Collaborate with engineering teams to ensure security best practices and secure software development life cycle SSDLC (Shift-Left).
* Improve cloud security monitoring by building and managing detections.


**This is you**
 To succeed in this role, we believe that you take great pride in your work, are curious and continuously want to learn and grow. Believing in collaboration and discussing ideas and concepts with your colleague, you will serve as the first point of contact for our Platform teams as a Cloud Security Subject Matter Expert to enable the delivery of great products.
   

  

**As a Security Engineer, You Have**
* Ability to work independently and as part of a team
* Detail-oriented mindset with a focus on delivering high-quality results.
* Strong stakeholder management skills, ability to work with both technical and non-technical stakeholders
* Ability to understand and implement security requirements in cloud environments
* Experience with security best practices and vulnerability management process
* Knowledge of Google Cloud Platform (Security Command Centre, GKE, IAM), infrastructure as code (Terraform) and Github
* Familiarity with programming and major frameworks (Java Spring, React)
* Knowledge of SIEM solutions and ability to do log analysis


**What We Offer**
* Your expertise and contribution will be appreciated from day one
* Plenty of opportunities to grow as a security professional
* Competitive salary and compensation


 We offer you the opportunity to work in a Nordic environment with a strong focus on delivery, product development and technology. Our ambitions are high and you will embark on a fast and challenging journey together with a skillful team of sharp and committed colleagues. Our teams are autonomous and embrace the agile way of working.
   

  

 Culture is built and cared for, each day by everyone. We’re proud of ours. Having a flat organization where anyone can talk to anyone creates a warm and friendly atmosphere worth protecting. We believe in a culture where every effort counts and where everyone is being recognized. A culture embracing our core values – passion, simplicity and transparency on all levels, no matter who you are or what you do.
   

  

 We are over 900 employees in Stockholm, Oslo, Helsinki and Copenhagen.
   

  

 Visit us on:
 **career.nordnetab.com/pages/engineering**
 Learn more about Nordnet in our brand movie
 **This is Nordnet** 
 , that describes our identity.
   

  

**Questions & applications**
 Apply today – we will start interviewing immediately. Please note that we do only accept applications through our recruitment system, hence no email applications will be considered.
   

  

 If you have questions, please contact Talent Acquisition Partner Keri Bergström Käll at keri.bergstrom.kall@nordnet.com
   

  

 We want to inform you that Nordnet conducts mandatory credit and background checks, as well as drug testing as a part of our recruitment process.
   

  

 We look forward to receiving your application!

title: Senior Azure Architect – Integration & D365
description:
**Swedium Global** 
 is the growing System Engineering and Solution Company, offers services like Semiconductor Engineering R&D Services, Embedded Systems Development, Custom Application Software Development, Web and Cloud Application Development, Testing Services, Consultancy and Outsourcing services to our clients across the globe for an onsite and offshore business model.
 



 Swedium Global is having presence in Sweden, Finland, Poland, Czech Republic and in India.
 



  





 Swedium Global is looking a
 **Senior Azure Architect** 




  





 We are now looking for a skilled Azure Architect. This is a critical role, where you will lead the architectural work around integrations in connection with a multi-market rollout of Dynamics 365 Finance & Operations.
 



**About the assignment** 




 As an Azure Architect, you will be responsible for designing scalable, future-proof integration solutions between D365 F&O and other business-critical systems. You’ll collaborate closely with developers, product owners, and business stakeholders to ensure alignment between technical solutions and strategic goals.
 



 While you’ll support the D365 implementation, the main focus will be on solution architecture and integration design, not hands-on configuration or development.
 



**Example responsibilities** 



* Design integration architecture between D365 F&O and external/internal systems
* Utilize Azure services such as Logic Apps, API Management, Azure Functions, and Service Bus
* Manage secure, high-performing APIs and data flows across systems
* Support development teams with architectural guidance and technical decisions
* Plan and optimize communication between systems to ensure performance and scalability
* Use Azure DevOps for CI/CD pipelines, version control, and release management
* Participate in integration testing and troubleshooting using Azure Portal and Postman
* Collaborate with D365 experts to align technical solutions with business needs



  
 



**Requirements** 



* Solid experience as an Azure Architect in complex system landscapes
* Proven track record designing integration solutions involving D365 Finance & Operations



**Strong proficiency in** 
 :
 


* Azure Logic Apps
* Azure Functions
* API Management
* Azure Key Vault
* Azure Service Bus
* Experience with Azure DevOps, CI/CD, and Git version control
* Ability to translate business requirements into robust technical architecture
* Excellent communication skills and the ability to work cross-functionally



  
 



**Nice to have** 



* Experience supporting D365 implementations from an architectural perspective
* Microsoft certifications within Azure and/or D365 (recommended but not required)

title: Platform Engineer
description:
**Techster Solutions** 
 befinner i dagsläget sig i en spännande tillväxtfas och söker nu fler kollegor, inledningsvis dig med minst
 **7+** 
 års erfarenhet och som kan stärka teamet.
   

  

 Du kan förvänta dig en omväxlande miljö, dagarna kan se väldigt olika ut - men en sak är säkert, här får du använda dina kompetenser och sätter själv gränsen för hur mycket du vill utvecklas. Som ett kunskapsbolag är det viktigt för oss att våra specialister delar med sig av sin kompetens och får kollegorna att växa.
   

  

**Rollbeskrivning** 
 :
   

  

 Power BI Admin Portal with Microsoft Fabric:
   

  

* Own the Power BI admin portal's responsibilities using Microsoft Fabric components in collaboration with Business stakeholders and Data Council.
* Utilize UI Fabric's theming and styling capabilities to customize the look and feel of the admin portal to align with organizational branding.
* Integrate UI Fabric into the admin portal to improve the accessibility and usability of administrative tasks and settings.
* Overall experience and knowledge with all the Fabric components and in aligned with the MS Fabric Roadmap.
* Allocate capacity and resources in Power BI Premium to optimize performance.
* Configure data gateways for on-premises data connectivity in Power BI Report Server.
* Develop custom data connectors using M or C# to connect to unique data sources.
* Register and manage custom connectors in the Power BI service.
* Monitor app usage and access permissions using REST APIs and custom solutions.
* Analyze usage metrics and auditing logs to identify usage patterns and performance issues, use Power BI REST APIs or third-party tools to automate monitoring tasks.
* Use Query Diagnostics to identify and optimize slow-performing queries.
* Monitor report performance and resource utilization to optimize report rendering.
* Automate administrative tasks using PowerShell scripts or REST APIs.
* Schedule tasks, such as data refreshes or content management, using automation.


**Power BI core Data Modeling and Transformation:**
* Utilize Power Query Editor to clean, shape, and transform data from various sources.
* Merge and append data tables to create unified datasets for reporting.
* Configure data refresh settings to keep datasets up to date with the latest data.
* Optimize data source connections for performance and efficiency.
* Define RLS roles and rules to restrict data access based on user roles or attributes.
* Test RLS configurations to ensure data security and access control.
* Generate compliance reports to monitor data usage, access patterns, and adherence to policies.
* Use audit logs to track user interactions with sensitive data.


**System Monitoring and Incident Response:** 
  

  

* Develop and manage monitoring tools and systems to track the health, performance, security, and availability of software applications, infrastructure components, and services.
* Set up alerts, dashboards, and metrics to proactively detect and respond to system outages, service disruptions, and performance incidents.
* Investigate and diagnose the root cause of incidents and work towards their resolution in a timely manner.


**Continuous Improvement and Collaboration:**
* Drive a culture of continuous improvement by identifying areas for automation, efficiency, and operational excellence.
* Document procedures, incidents, and best practices to facilitate knowledge sharing and improve team efficiency.
* Stay abreast of industry trends, emerging technologies, and best practices to propose innovative solutions that enhance system reliability and performance.
* Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams, including developers, system administrators, and network engineers, to ensure smooth operation of systems.


**Qualifications**
* Bachelor's degree in computer science, Engineering, or a related field (or equivalent experience) with 7+ years of IT experience.
* Strong Power BI Admin experience.
* Proficient in scripting/programming languages such as Python, Bash (Recommended).
* Experience with cloud platforms (Google Cloud Platform & Azure preferred).
* Experience in DevOps practice, CI/CD and monitoring tools.
* Experience with automation tools and configuration management frameworks such as Terraform, Puppet or Ansible (Recommended).
* Strong troubleshooting and problem-solving skills with a keen attention to detail
* Excellent communication and collaboration skills to work effectively in a cross-functional team environment.
* Strong experience in system administration, infrastructure management, or site reliability engineering
* Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, agile environment and handle multiple priorities.


**Tech Stack (in a flash):**
 Power BI (Fabric), Power BI Admin suite (Fabric), GCP, Azure, Python, Terraform, Git, SQL, Bash, Docker, PowerShell, ServiceNow, Atlassian.
   

  

**Required cloud certification:** 
 power bi
   

  

**Ansökan**
 Tror du att du är
 **Techster Solutions** 
 nästa stjärna? Tveka då inte att skicka in din ansökan redan nu. Urval sker löpande och tillträde sker enligt överenskommelse.
   

  

 Arbetsplats och kultur
   

  

 Vi är ett entreprenördrivet IT företag, med både produktkunskap och försäljning (Techster AB) och konsultativa tjänster (Techster Solutions AB). Det innebär att vi är mycket öppna för nya tekniska lösningar, kunskapsutbyte och ständigt lärande. Att ha roligt och samtidigt behålla den familjära andan utan hierarkier är lika viktigt.
   

  

 Vi vill skapa det konsultbolag som du alltid velat jobba för, men kanske inte hittat ännu. Redan idag har vi en blandning av seniora och yngre medarbetare, såväl som män och kvinnor. Det vill vi fortsätta att bygga på. Så välkommen med din ansökan!

title: Solutions Engineer
description:
It's strategic execution at high velocity— you need to be technically sharp, commercially astute, and thrive in fast-paced sales environments.
   

  

 At Upsales, we're not “another CRM vendor.” We're building the most advanced AI-driven revenue platform in Europe. We're looking for a Solutions Engineer who combines deep technical insight, polished professionalism, and the drive to close complex deals.
   

  

 What you’ll be doing
   

  

 As a Solutions Engineer, you will join an elite team, directly influencing our ambitious growth targets by optimizing the sales process. You'll be the technical backbone for our sales teams, a crucial player in closing deals by translating complex customer needs into tailored Upsales solutions.
   

  

* You'll take full ownership of the technical sales support, empowering sales and account managers to secure more business by:
* Becoming the ultimate product expert, staying relentlessly updated on every product development and feature.
* Rapidly understanding prospect and customer challenges and demonstrating with precision how Upsales delivers tangible value.
* Crafting and showcasing bespoke customer solutions, making complex integrations feel simple.
* Leading high-impact workshops and executing critical proof-of-concepts.
* Serving as the trusted technical advisor, navigating and resolving any technical hurdles throughout the sales cycle.


 Who we’re looking for
   

  

 You're a true professional—someone who earns the room's respect by showing up prepared, knowing your stuff, and making complex things feel simple. You combine deep technical acumen, sharp commercial instincts, and outstanding communication skills. If you're the type who relentlessly finds solutions where others see roadblocks, you'll thrive here.
   

  

**Beyond That, We Believe You Have**
* Proven experience as a Solutions Engineer, or extensive project management/customization experience within the software industry (ideally CRM, Marketing Automation, or ERP), backed by a technical or engineering university degree (or equivalent).
* A relentless curiosity and the ability to dive deep into technical details.
* Exceptional technical understanding, particularly of AI, APIs, and integrations.
* Fluency in both Swedish and English.
* A background in sales with a desire to transition into a deeply technical, customer-facing role.


 Upsales is a bootstrapped company with big ambitions, known for our high-performing team, relentless curiosity, and a culture that challenges conventional thinking. From product to sales, we’re obsessed with creating real value for our customers and building software that actually moves the needle.

title: AI Engineer
description:
**About Gilion:**
 Our mission is clear: We are accelerating founders in their growth journey through our Gilion platform. As a growing product company leveraging AI, we are creating an innovative, technically challenging platform revolutionizing how businesses grow - with the key of the platform being analytics, unique AI forecasting, ultimately enabling access to financing and non-dillutive funding, - in a way never done before. Watch our platform here: gilion.com/platform
   

  

 Our team is made up of experts who have been part of leading companies like Spotify, Google, King, Sinch, bringing a wealth of experience and a passion for pushing boundaries. At Gilion, you’ll be part of a fast-moving, dynamic environment where your work will have a tangible impact on both our product and the industry as a whole. If you’re excited about working with challenging technology and making a real difference, Gilion is the place for you.
   

  

**About the role:**
 You’ll join our data team to build the backbone that powers Gilion’s AI-driven financial analysis. Your mission: make customer data analysis-ready and accessible to AI agents in a scalable, automated way. This means building services, data models, and integrations.
   

  

* Design, build, and maintain backend services that process and serve customer data for AI agent analysis.
* Define and implement semantic layers and metrics (e.g., lifetime value) to standardize analysis across customers.
* Collaborate with AI orchestration systems to ensure agents have the right tools (MCPs) and data for their tasks.
* Continuously refine automated analysis workflows to improve accuracy, scalability, and robustness.
* Work closely with product and engineering teams to expand data capabilities and handle new data types or sources.
* Monitor, troubleshoot, and optimize data pipelines and services.


**Background/Profile:**
* Experience in analytics engineering or data engineering roles.
* Backend development skills (Python or similar), with ability to build services and APIs.
* Proficiency in SQL and experience with data modeling and data warehouses.
* Understanding of data quality principles and automated data validation.
* Interest in or exposure to AI-driven data analysis - comfortable working in an environment where AI agents consume your data pipelines.


**What we offer:**
* Work-life balance, hybrid-remote model
* Diverse, inclusive and knowledge-sharing culture
* Experienced founders, backed by top investors
* A growth journey with tons of development opportunities
* AI product that impacts how companies grow, disrupting the industry

title: Systemutvecklare med inriktning DevOps
job_function: Business Development, Engineering, and Information Technology
description:
Det är inte en superhjälte som vi söker men definitivt någon som har ett systemperspektiv och vill jobba med helheten. Drivs du av att få möjlighet att jobba med olika tekniker och vara en möjliggörare för våra devopsteam? Vill du jobba i ett plattformsteam där ni tillsammans skapar en grundstruktur för utveckling, drift och förvaltning av IT-tjänster?Digg ansvarar för infrastruktur och tjänster som ska användas av många olika offentliga aktörer. Nu förstärker vi inom IT-avdelningen och söker en kollega till vårt Plattformsteam.
   

  

 Om jobbet
   

  

 Vårt fokus är att bygga upp den gemensamma digitala infrastrukturen för att kunna förse både det offentliga Sverige, privata aktörer och medborgare med digitala tjänster. Exempel på tjänster som vi utvecklar och driftar finns inom säker meddelandeutväxling, elektronisk identifiering och digital plånbok. För att nå dit satsar vi nu starkt på att bygga vidare på vår egna IT-leveransförmåga. Vi har idag ett flertal devopsteam och ett plattformsteam. Uppdraget är bland annat att utveckla applikationer och etablera den tekniska plattformen som krävs för att vi ska kunna realisera och möjliggöra en effektiv leverans av våra digitala tjänster.
   

  

 Vår tekniska målmiljö är ett antal kubernetes-kluster från Red Hat (Openshift 4) där vi idag driftar egna tjänster, utvecklingsmiljöer och vår CI/CD-pipelines. Vi utvecklar mikrotjänster i Java och Quarkus samt använder Vue för frontendutveckling med typescript. Om du har erfarenheter av större datacenter och Linux-serverdrift är det enbart positivt då vi har ett eget datacenter.I vårt plattformsteam kommer du tillsammans med dina teamkollegor bl.a. konfigurera för deployment av applikationer och andra funktioner som loggning och övervakning av driftsatta applikationer.
   

  

 Om dig
   

  

 För det här jobbet behöver du ha något års erfarenhet inom Systemutveckling och/eller inom DevOps/Systemadministration och tycka att det är roligt att arbeta med komplexa frågor. Du har lätt att anpassa dig och arbetar mot mål och resultat. Du är uppmärksam och tillmötesgående i ditt bemötande och du har intresse, vilja och förmåga att hjälpa andra, dela med dig av din kunskap och leverera lösningar.
   

  

 För att lyckas och trivas i rollen ser vi att du har följande kompetenser, erfarenheter och kunskaper:
   

  

 Kompetenser:
   

  

* Samarbetsförmåga - Du samarbetar bra med andra genom att du lyssnar, kommunicerar och kan ge och ta feedback på ett konstruktivt sätt. Du tar dig an uppgifter med nyfikenhet och fokuserar på ditt och andras lärande.
* Problemlösande analysförmåga - Du arbetar bra med komplexa frågor. Du analyserar och bryter ner problem i sina beståndsdelar och löser komplicerade problem.
* Flexibel - Du har lätt för att anpassa dig till ändrade omständigheter. Du ser möjligheterna i förändring.


 Erfarenheter och kunskaper:
   

  

* minst 2 års erfarenhet av konfiguration av applikationer för deployment i Kubernetes/Openshift
* minst 2 års erfarenhet av arbete i agila team och av GitOps
* minst 3 års erfarenhet av Linux som utvecklings och driftmiljö
* minst 3 års erfarenhet av Docker/Podman och av versionshantering i git eller motsvarande
* goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska, i både tal och skrift


 Meriterande erfarenheter och kunskaper:
   

  

* erfarenhet av utveckling i Java
* erfarenhet av nätverksadministration och Linuxadministration
* erfarenhet av Istio och av PKI-hantering samt av administration av gitlab och nexus
* erfarenhet av agil utveckling och av argoCD


 Utbildning:
   

  

* akademisk utbildning eller motsvarande som vi bedömer som relevant


 Om Digg
   

  

 Digg är en myndighet som arbetar brett med att stödja och samordna digitaliseringen av den svenska offentliga förvaltningen. Vi utvecklar digital infrastruktur och tjänster som hjälper andra offentliga aktörer i deras digitalisering. Vi säkerställer även att digital offentlig service är tillgänglig för alla.
   

  

**Eventuell organisationsförändring**
 I syfte att stärka digitaliseringsarbetet har regeringen gett Digg och Post-och telestyrelsen (PTS) i uppdrag att lämna förslag på hur våra två myndigheter skulle kunna gå samman till en gemensam. Redovisningen lämnades till regeringen 14 mars och vi inväntar nu besked om en organisationsförändring ska genomföras. Vårt arbete med att digitalisera Sverige fortsätter, vi hoppas du vill vara med på resan.
   

  

 Redovisning av uppdrag att lämna förslag på organisationsförändring
   

  

 Hos oss arbetar engagerade personer som alla har en viktig roll i digitaliseringen av Sverige. Vi rekryterar långsiktigt och det är viktigt att du som medarbetare mår bra, har möjlighet att utvecklas på jobbet och trivs med det du gör. Diggs huvudkontor finns i centrala Sundsvall i moderna aktivitetsbaserade lokaler. Vi har också ett mindre och modernt kontor i centrala Stockholm. Vi är positivt inställda till att ge utrymme för distansarbete utifrån verksamheten och individens behov, men det förväntas att du är på kontoret som minst en dag i veckan och när arbetet kräver det. Distansarbetets omfattning varierar mellan olika personer utifrån verksamhetens behov.
   

  

**Vi erbjuder**
* Vi erbjuder tillsvidareanställning med tillträde enligt överenskommelse, anställningen inleds med sex månaders provanställning.
* Placeringsort för den här tjänsten är Sundsvall eller Stockholm.
* Resor förekommer men antal kan variera över tid.
* Då anställningen är placerad i säkerhetsklass krävs svenskt medborgarskap och en säkerhetsprövning och registerkontroll kommer att genomföras. Mer information om vad säkerhetsprövning innebär kan du få här.
* Det kan även komma att bli aktuellt med beredskapstjänstgöring. Generösa förmåner. Läs mer på digg.se


 Sök
   

  

 Vi strävar efter att ha en så snabb, effektiv och fördomsfri process som möjligt och arbetar därför löpande, strukturerat och systematiskt med vårt urval. Ägna inte onödig tid åt att uppdatera ditt cv, svara istället på våra urvalsfrågor i ansökan.
   

  

 Sista ansökningsdag är 29 augusti, 2025
   

  

 Har du frågor om rekryteringen är du välkommen att kontakta enhetschef Niklas Karlsson via epost extern.niklas.karlsson@digg.se alternativt om du har allmänna frågor om Digg som arbetsplats, eller specifikt plattformsteamet, kontakta systemutvecklaren Jonathan Bonde på jonathan.bonde@digg.se. Fackliga kontaktpersoner är Mattias Ekhem för Saco-S och Åsa Fridholm för ST. De nås via växeln på 0771-11 44 00.
   

  

 Vi tar gärna emot frågor från dig som är intresserad av att jobba hos oss men tackar nej till dig som säljer annonser och rekryteringstjänster.

title: Analytics Engineer
description:
Nordnet is a leading pan-Nordic digital platform, bringing the joy of savings and investments to our customers. Our ambition is to inspire, encourage and enable everyone to take their savings to the next level, no matter who they are.
   

  

 We believe that data is a cornerstone for our future success, and we're building the next generation of banking on Google Cloud Platform (GCP), with our analytics platform having moved to GCP in 2020.
   

  

 Now we're looking for a passionate Analytics Engineer to be the bridge between business and data technology. At Nordnet, we strive to be data pioneers, devoted to harnessing the potential of data and AI. If you want to transform raw information into clear, meaningful data products that impact how we grow, innovate, and enhance our services, this could be your perfect fit.
   

  

**We would love it if you feel excited about at least some of these statements:**
* Designing and building elegant data structures in BigQuery.
* Ensuring data is accurate and reliable.
* Empowering others by making data models and dashboards accessible and understandable for everyone.
* Collaborating with diverse teams, bringing their data needs to life through your expertise.


**This is you**
 You're passionate about data and learning new things, and you are a problem solver who wants to contribute with your experience and ideas. In your work, you are organised, methodical and agile in a way that benefits the team environment and ability to deliver solutions.
   

  

**To thrive in this role, we believe that most of these criteria describe you:**
* Have several years of experience as an Analytics Engineer/Business Intelligence Developer/Data Engineer.
* Skilled in designing and building data warehouses and analytics platforms
* Apply software engineering best practices like code reviews to ensure our work is of high quality.
* A clear communicator who can simplify complex concepts with ease.
* Exhibit deep SQL knowledge and experience with dbt.
* Looker (or similar) knowledge for creating inspiring dashboards.


**What We Offer**
 You would be a part of the Data & Insights department, consisting of smart and skilled Analytics Engineers, Data Engineers, Data Scientists and Data Analysts. Here, you'll not only learn and grow but also contribute with your unique perspective to our success.
   

  

 We provide our team with a modern tech stack and actively explore the future of data, experimenting with AI to improve how we consume and create data products. You will enjoy the flexibility of hybrid working and a competitive salary and compensation package.
   

  

 At Nordnet, data is a fundamental part of how we make decisions and innovate. If you're eager to make a difference and work with exciting technology in a supportive and empowering environment, we warmly encourage you to apply!
   

  

 You are welcome to apply today, but the interviews will start in August.
   

  

**Application**
 If you have questions, please contact Alva Hellberg, Talent Acquisition Partner, at
 **alva.hellberg@nordnet.se** 
 .
   

  

 Apply today– we will start interviewing in late August after summer vacations. Please note that we do only accept applications through our recruitment system, hence no email applications will be considered.
   

  

 We want to inform you that Nordnet conducts mandatory credit and background checks, as well as drug testing as a part of our recruitment process.
   

  

 We look forward to receiving your application!

title: Platform Success Manager
description:
**FICO (NYSE: FICO)** 
 is a leading global analytics software company, helping businesses in 100+ countries make better decisions. Join our world-class team today and fulfill your career potential!
   

  

**The Opportunity**
*“As a Platform Success Manager, you will serve as a strategic advisor and trusted partner to enterprise customers leveraging the FICO Platform. Balancing business acumen with technical understanding, you will ensure customers achieve measurable value through effective platform adoption, operational alignment, and ongoing engagement. Your mission is to drive customer success by aligning platform capabilities with strategic goals, ensuring both business impact and operational excellence.”* 
 - Platform Success, Senior Director
   

  

**What You'll Contribute**
* Build and maintain strong, trust-based relationships with business stakeholders, product owners, and executive sponsors.
* Conduct strategic planning and regular business reviews to align platform usage with customers' evolving goals.
* Drive value realization by linking platform capabilities to business outcomes across industries like banking, insurance, and telecom.
* Lead enablement and ongoing engagement efforts to maximize customer adoption and satisfaction.
* Promote usage of platform features through best practices, tailored training, and data-driven recommendations.
* Facilitate change management and empower customers to become self-sufficient users of the platform.
* Partner with technical teams (DevOps, Engineering, IT) to ensure secure, scalable, and compliant platform deployments.
* Monitor key performance indicators (KPIs), usage patterns, and service health to proactively identify risks or optimization opportunities.
* Support incident response and ensure timely communication, transparency, and continuous improvement.
* Act as the voice of the customer across internal teams, influencing product direction and support priorities based on field insights.
* Work closely with Sales and Professional Services to identify expansion opportunities and align on customer growth strategies.
* Develop and maintain success plans that integrate functional outcomes, platform performance metrics, and strategic objectives.


**What We're Seeking**
* 5+ years of experience in customer success, platform consulting, or strategic account management, preferably with enterprise SaaS/PaaS platforms.
* Demonstrated ability to engage both business and technical stakeholders, translating complex concepts into clear value propositions.
* Strong business acumen and experience driving measurable outcomes in highly regulated or data-driven industries.
* Familiarity with cloud-native platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP), APIs, and platform health metrics—enough to collaborate effectively with technical teams.
* Excellent communication, facilitation, and stakeholder management skills.
* Bachelor’s degree in Business, Information Systems, Computer Science, or a related field.


**Our Offer to You**
* An inclusive culture strongly reflecting our core values: Act Like an Owner, Delight Our Customers and Earn the Respect of Others.
* The opportunity to make an impact and develop professionally by leveraging your unique strengths and participating in valuable learning experiences.
* Highly competitive compensation, benefits and rewards programs that encourage you to bring your best every day and be recognized for doing so.
* An engaging, people-first work environment offering work/life balance, employee resource groups, and social events to promote interaction and camaraderie.


**Why Make a Move to FICO?**
 At FICO, you can develop your career with a leading organization in one of the fastest-growing fields in technology today – Big Data analytics. You’ll play a part in our commitment to help businesses use data to improve every choice they make, using advances in artificial intelligence, machine learning, optimization, and much more.
   

  

 FICO makes a real difference in the way businesses operate worldwide:
   

  

* Credit Scoring — FICO® Scores are used by 90 of the top 100 US lenders.
* Fraud Detection and Security — 4 billion payment cards globally are protected by FICO fraud systems.
* Lending — 3/4 of US mortgages are approved using the FICO Score.


 Global trends toward digital transformation have created tremendous demand for FICO’s solutions, placing us among the world’s top 100 software companies by revenue. We help many of the world’s largest banks, insurers, retailers, telecommunications providers and other firms reach a new level of success. Our success is dependent on really talented people – just like you – who thrive on the collaboration and innovation that’s nurtured by a diverse and inclusive environment. We’ll provide the support you need, while ensuring you have the freedom to develop your skills and grow your career. Join FICO and help change the way business thinks!
   

  

 Learn more about how you can fulfil your potential at www.fico.com/Careers
   

  

 FICO promotes a culture of inclusion and seeks to attract a diverse set of candidates for each job opportunity. We are an equal employment opportunity employer and we’re proud to offer employment and advancement opportunities to all candidates without regard to race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, pregnancy, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. Research has shown that women and candidates from underrepresented communities may not apply for an opportunity if they don’t meet all stated qualifications. While our qualifications are clearly related to role success, each candidate’s profile is unique and strengths in certain skill and/or experience areas can be equally effective. If you believe you have many, but not necessarily all, of the stated qualifications we encourage you to apply.
   

  

 Information submitted with your application is subject to the FICO Privacy policy at https://www.fico.com/en/privacy-policy

title: Staff Engineer - Storage Services, Core Group
description:
**About Wolt**
 At Wolt, we create technology that brings joy, simplicity and earnings to the neighborhoods of the world. In 2014 we started with delivery of restaurant food. Now we’re building the delivery of (almost) everything and you’ll find us in over 500 cities in 30 countries around the world. In 2022 we joined forces with DoorDash and together we keep on dreaming big and expanding across the globe.
   

  

 Working at Wolt isn’t always easy, but it’s definitely exciting. Here you’ll learn more, build more, and ship more than in most other companies. You’ll be challenged a lot, but also have a lot of fun on the way. So, if you’re a self-starter with drive and entrepreneurial spirit, this could be the ride of your life.
   

  

 As part of
 **Wolt’s Platform department (Core Group)** 
 , you will contribute to the reliability and scalability of our datastores, and work on the future unified storage platform we are building together with DoorDash.
   

  

 We are looking for an experienced Staff Engineer specializing in storage reliability and building systems at scale to join the Platform department. In this role, you will lead the design and implementation of scalable platform solutions to support our e-commerce business, serving over
 **42 million monthly active users** 
 and
 **500,000+ merchants** 
 . As a Staff Engineer, you will define technical direction, mentor other engineers, and ensure our platform architecture can sustain rapid growth while staying reliable.
   

  

 What you’ll be doing
   

  

**Technical Leadership:** 
 Provide technical direction and leadership to multiple storage teams, set best practices for data storage. Oversee development and migration to the unified platform with DoorDash, ensuring high availability and data consistency.
   

  

**Growth Support:** 
 Lead the design and development of a robust, scalable storage architecture that supports our business goals and organic growth.
   

  

**Mentor:** 
 Mentor and guide engineers at various levels, fostering a culture of continuous learning and improvement. Act as an evangelist for database optimization and best practices within the organization.
   

  

**Collaborate:** 
 Work closely with Wolt and DoorDash teams responsible for foundational systems and services, such as compute and infrastructure, as well as product development teams, to ensure platform initiatives align with business goals and needs.
   

  

**Documentation:** 
 Maintain comprehensive documentation of platform architecture, design decisions, and best practices to facilitate knowledge sharing and onboarding. Participate in writing and reviewing RFCs.
   

  

**Security:** 
 Support implementation of the security best practices to protect data and maintain the integrity of our platform in alignment with our Security Engineers.
   

  

**Observability:** 
 Improve dashboards and alerts, and drive their adoption. Working together with the Observability team, ensure engineers have the tools and visibility needed to quickly detect, investigate, and resolve issues.
   

  

**Hands-on:** 
 Work directly on implementation when needed, including POCs and debugging complex technical problems.
   

  

 Our humble expectations
   

  

 Must haves:
   

  

* 2+ years of proven experience as a Technical Lead (e.g. Staff or Principal Engineer) in large-scale companies.
* 8+ years of hands-on experience in software engineering and designing systems at scale.
* Deep understanding of non-relational databases (Cassandra preferred): best practices, performance optimization, data modeling, migration strategies, partitioning and sharding concepts.
* Strong understanding of SRE and security best practices.
* Proficiency in Go programming language.
* Experience working with one of streaming platforms (Kafka and Kafka Connect preferred).
* Strong communication and collaboration skills.
* Proactive, data-driven mindset with the ability to drive changes across the entire organisation.
* Experience in supporting large-scale development teams across multiple locations.


 Nice to haves:
   

  

* 
+ Experience working with relational databases (PostgreSQL preferred) and AWS RDS.
+ Knowledge of IaC tools (Terraform preferred) and orchestration tools (Kubernetes preferred).
+ Experience using Python for tasks and processes automation.
+ Familiarity with SOX compliance.


 Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion
   

  

 We’re committed to growing and empowering a more inclusive community within our company, industry, and cities. That’s why we hire and cultivate diverse teams of people from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We believe that true innovation happens when everyone has room at the table and the tools, resources, and opportunity to excel.

title: Business Developer - Norway
description:
Intric is accelerating its growth, driven by a fresh round of funding from investors and strong demand from both existing and new customers.
   

  

 Our platform - Intric.ai - is currently transforming how work is done, primarily within the public sector and companies that value data sovereignty, by making the power of AI accessible to a wider audience. We have secured a market-leading position in a niche of this segment.
   

  

 We are seeking a motivated individual eager to embark on the journey of a lifetime with our expanding and driven team.
   

  

**Your role**
 As a Business Developer you are at the core of the sales team, helping accelerating our growth by expanding the use of our platform to new customers, primarily focusing on the Norwegian market.
   

  

**Who You Are**
* Passionate about business development and interested in AI.
* Solution-oriented with an entrepreneurial spirit who gets things done.
* Enjoy working in a fast-paced, agile environment.
* We think you have 1-2 years of experience in similar roles or demonstrable achievements in relevant areas. Experience with a startup is considered extra relevant.
* Fluent in Norwegian, social, driven, and eager to learn new things.


**Key Responsibilities**
 As a part of our sales team, one of your primary responsibilities is to bring our revolutionary product to both new and existing markets. This will include executing activities such as:
   

  

* Building up and establishing our presence on the Norwegian market
* Talking to potential customers and understand their needs
* Negotiating and closing deals
* Sourcing and initiating potential partnership opportunities
* Do what it takes to hit targets and deadlines, which might include proactive demand generation and finding creative ways to build the sales pipeline


**What We Offer**
* An opportunity to be a part of building a system and company that defines the future
* Rapid career development in an exciting, fast-moving sector
* Competitive compensation package combining salary and stock options

title: Senior Data Engineer- Databricks and Data Products
description:
**Job Description:** 

 We are seeking an experienced
 **Senior Data Engineer** 
 with strong hands-on expertise in
 **Databricks** 
 and
 **Data Product development** 
 to join our client’s team onsite in
 **Stockholm** 
 . This role is ideal for someone who combines deep technical skills with a product-oriented mindset and thrives in a collaborative, fast-paced environment.
 


**Key Responsibilities:** 
1. Design, develop, and optimize scalable data pipelines using
 **Databricks** 
 , Spark, and cloud platforms.
2. Collaborate with data scientists, analysts, and business stakeholders to deliver high-quality data products.
3. Implement and maintain data architecture, modeling, and engineering best practices.
4. Ensure data quality, governance, and performance standards across pipelines.
5. Support the full data product lifecycle—from ideation and prototyping to deployment and maintenance.
6. Contribute to defining data engineering standards and driving continuous improvement initiatives.


**Required Skills & Experience:** 
1. 5+ years of experience in
 **data engineering** 
 roles.
2. Strong hands-on experience with
 **Databricks** 
 , Spark, and at least one major cloud platform (Azure, AWS, or GCP).
3. Experience in building and maintaining
 **data products** 
 in an enterprise environment.

 .

title: Senior Reverse Engineer - Anti-Cheat
description:
As a Senior Reverse Engineer at Embark you will be part of the Anti-Cheat team focusing on creating a safe, secure and fair environment for players of our games.
   

  

 The Anti-Cheat team at Embark is a centralized team responsible for all anti-cheat efforts.
   

  

 The role of Senior Reverse Engineer includes driving our anti-cheat reverse engineering efforts mainly for two of our projects as a starting point.
   

  

 Your passion for technology and games is what is driving you to great success. By being curious and experimental you aim to solve problems in a game-changing way.
   

  

 Your work would primarily involve building critical in-house expertise on cheat technologies, enhancing our ability to detect cheats and defend against them.
   

  

****Example of responsibilities****
* Conducting debugging and reverse engineering on cheats using tools like IDA and/or Ghidra
* Providing the anti-cheat team with effective countermeasures against cheats
* Staying on top of trends regarding game cheats
* Researching the latest advancements in cheat technologies both software and hardware related


****We would love if you have****
* A creative and curious mind
* Documented experience in reverse engineering
* Documented experience with software-/hardware-based cheat technologies
* Good understanding of x64-86 systems programming
* Good understanding of Windows internals
* Good understanding of network protocols and security
* Professional English communication skills


 At Embark we offer competitive salaries, passionate colleagues to share knowledge with and much more, but most of all we invite you to take part of a journey into the unknown, to build creative, surprising and beautiful experiences together.
   

  

 We welcome game makers of all sex, class, colour, age, gender identity, education, religion, opinion, culture, nation of origin, language, sexual orientation, shape, size, and ability.
   

  

 Did we leave anyone out? Well, we welcome you, too! We think that the gaming industry is made better when everyone has a seat at the table.
   

  

 Be yourself at Embark and make games while doing so. Please apply with confidence. We can’t wait to hear from you (in English)!

title: Senior Software Developer
company_industry: Technology, Information and Internet and Financial Services
description:
Here at Billogram, we like to be the good guys of billing, making money when clients are happy and pay on time, rather than from missed payments. We believe it always pays off to treat people well. That's why our platform for invoices and payments is built to remove pain points and instead be beneficial to both our clients and their customers, improving their relationships. We’re looking for a talented Senior Software Developer to join our Stockholm team in a hybrid role and help us shape the future of billing!
 



  





**About the Role** 




 We’re looking for a Senior Developer who’s excited by the challenge of rethinking how billing gets done. If you love collaborating with a diverse team, finding new angles to solve problems, and making an impact on real customer experiences, you’ll fit right in. You’ll join a friendly crew of developers, product managers, and other stakeholders who share a passion for building a great platform to prove that great business grows from great relationships. This is a flexible hybrid role based in Stockholm, with no relocation assistance offered.
 



  





**What You’ll Do** 



* **Standardize & Scale** 
 : Help shape a platform that’s ready to grow into new European markets. You’ll refactor, optimize, and test our systems so they can handle more transactions and delight more users.
* **Tackle Tech Debt** 
 : Fine-tune existing solutions so they run smoothly for larger clients, higher traffic, and increased complexity.
* **Create Real Value** 
 : Dive into coding, requirement analysis, and testing to build features that our clients and their customers will love.
* **Lead & Collaborate** 
 : Work side by side with other developers, share fresh ideas, guide technical decisions, and keep our platform moving forward.



  





**What We’re Looking For** 




 We want someone humble, hungry, and happy: eager to grow, curious about how things can improve, and excited about shaping the future of billing. You enjoy discussing big ideas but are also comfortable rolling up your sleeves to make them happen.
 



  





**Key Qualifications** 



* **Language Expertise** 
 : At least 4 years of professional experience in PHP or Python (ideally both, but strong in one with openness to learn the other works too), ideally working on products with real-world impact.
* **Adaptability** 
 : An openness to learning new tools in our stack (think AWS, databases, and more).
* **Product Mindset** 
 : Comfortable in a collaborative, product-focused environment, where everyone’s ideas matter.
* **Problem-Solver** 
 : A knack for breaking down complex challenges into clean, maintainable solutions.



  





**Bonus Skills** 



* **B2B & B2C Background** 
 : Experience building solutions for business and consumer needs.
* **Scaling Know-How** 
 : Exposure to international expansion or platforms that operate across borders.
* **Payments Experience** 
 : A couple of years (or more) dealing with payment systems, transactions, or other financial services.



  





**Why Work with Us?** 




 At Billogram we promise you an exciting journey as we break into new markets and grow at a rapid pace. That aside you will get lots of freedom and opportunity to develop together with great colleagues at our office, right in the center of Stockholm. We also offer flexible working hours, exciting challenges and a whole lot of laughs.
 



  





 We're committed to your long-term development, offering clear career progression paths. You'll also enjoy a fantastic benefits package, including 30 (+2) days of holiday, an occupational pension, a flexible wellness allowance, sick leave top-up, and parental leave compensation. At Billogram, our inclusive and diverse culture ensures that everyone can enjoy a fulfilling career and a great work-life balance.
 



  





 This recruitment process is managed internally, and we respectfully request no contact from recruitment agencies.
 



  





 At Billogram, we provide equal opportunities and strive for an inclusive and diverse environment. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to gender, transgender identity or expression, ethnicity, religion or other beliefs, disability, sexual orientation, or age.
 



 Welcome to the world of Billogram!

title: Global Sales Engineer with a focus on E2E - Lund Integration
description:
Job Title
Global Sales Engineer with a focus on E2E - Lund Integration
Job Description*Are you passionate about creating great customer experience while becoming an expert in a central part of our product portfolio?* *Do you want to work closely with a dedicated team while being supported by a global organization? This is a chance to take on an exciting challenge, work with cutting-edge technology, and grow in a truly international environment.* *We are now looking for a Global Sales Engineer to join us at our HQ in Lund, Sweden!*  

Who is your future team?
Our vision is to contribute to a smarter and safer world by providing market leading end-to-end (E2E) surveillance solutions (https://www.axis.com/solutions/axis-end-to-end-solutions-for-surveillance). Our E2E solutions are built around our own video management solutions, AXIS Camera Station Pro and AXIS Camera Station Edge, but the functionality extends beyond that.  

The End-to-End Solutions team has global product management responsibility for Axis End-to-End Solutions for Surveillance. The team consists of product managers, product specialists and other roles that together manage the entire life cycle of our solutions - from strategic planning to tactical activities, go to market, and maintenance. We are looking for an Global Sales Engineer with a focus on E2E Integration to join the team.  

What you'll do here as an Global Sales Engineer?
As an Global Sales Engineer in the End-to-End Solutions Knowledge Management team you will work in a small but engaged team who have solution knowledge associated with the AXIS Camera Station Solution. This role will specifically have a focus on partners developing solutions that are integrated using our API. The main responsibilities are:  

  

* Maintain the network of development partners which includes vetting and gatekeeping access to the API.
* Understand the partners use case and based on these propose how to integrate with the End-to-End Solutions.
* Be responsible for developing and making available documentation used to help partners understand how to integrate our solutions.
* Be the interface to R&D regarding API development and support.
* Be the main responsible person when assisting the Regional Sales Engineers in E2E integration projects.

  

Expectations on the Integration Specialist for E2E  

The Integration Specialist for E2E is expected to build the deepest technical competence associated with the API used to integrate the solution.  

  

You will be expected to contribute with expert knowledge in all phases of the sales and support cycle. The main focus is in pre-sales phases when partners/end-customers are developing integrations to the E2E solutions but you will be responsible for maintaining relationships with strategic development partners. You will also be expected to give feedback to R&D how APIs are used by partners and what documentation that is needed.  

  

You will act proactively as a technical expert, sharing knowledge and supporting different functions in the organization. With this expertise you will develop documentation, training, presentations and similar material when appropriate.  

  

Who are we looking for?  

You have a technical interest and natural system solution thinking. You have good communication and networking skills and are senior enough to be comfortable in taking decisions. You are also business oriented and have a good understanding of project sales cycle.  

You have relevant (Bachelor’s or Master’s) degree or similar and more than 5 years’ experience within system engineering and at least some years with customer relations. It is of great value if you have technical knowledge and experience from working with Axis video management systems, Windows OS, virtualization, cloud solutions and computer networks. You also have documented work with system solutions close to end customers.  

You have social skills and the ability to manage and perform in a multi-cultural environment where you collaborate with remote colleagues. You enjoy a high pace, comfortable with having multiple activities going on in parallel and context switching. You are always open to customers and colleagues, contributing to a good team spirit and a productive environment. Furthermore, we believe you have:* A pedagogic approach, both spoken and written, when explaining technical matters
* An excellent understanding of Axis' products and services.
* Excellent English skills, written and verbal.
* Swedish language skills: not essential, but a distinct advantage

  

What Axis Has To Offer  

We are a world leader in network video, where cutting-edge technology meets global impact. Here, you’ll contribute to meaningful projects that shape the future of security and surveillance — developing solutions used worldwide.
As a fast-growing company, we offer exciting career opportunities. You’ll grow professionally through continuous learning, supported by a collaborative team that values creativity, innovation, and work-life balance.  

  

 Our Lund HQ Campus, including the impressive Grenden building, offers a dynamic environment with spaces crafted to encourage collaboration, whether through informal “fika*” chats, formal meetings,*or after-hours activities.*Check it out:* Axis HQ  

Your well-being matters to us. We offer a range of benefits, including a company bonus, Friday cake, wellness allowance, health insurance — and even your own Axis bicycle.  

To learn more about Axis, our innovative products, solutions, and vibrant company culture, explore:
Life at Axis blog
Engineering at Axis blog
Innovation at Axis
Ready to Act?
Axis is a company realizing the benefits of a diverse workforce. We know that diversity in groups creates a better working environment and promotes creativity, something that is fundamental for our success. We welcome all applications.  

We go through applications continuously so don’t wait – send in your application today!  

In case of questions, please reach out to recruiting manager Matthew Meade at +46 46 272 3332.
Type of Employment
Permanent Employment
Posting End Date
2025-09-17*Certain roles at Axis require background checks, which means applicable verifications will be done in these recruitments.* *Notice will be provided before we take any action.*
About Axis Communications
We enable a smarter, safer world by creating innovative solutions for improving security and business performance. As a network technology company and industry leader, we offer solutions in video surveillance, access control, intercom, and audio systems, enhanced by intelligent analytics applications.
With around 5000 committed employees in over 50 countries, we collaborate with partners worldwide. Together, we thrive in our friendly, open, and collaborative culture and inspire each other to think beyond the expected. United by our commitment to inclusion, diversity, and sustainability, we consistently seek to develop our skills and way of working.
Let´s create a smarter, safer world
For more information about Axis, please visit our website www.axis.com.
Listen to Get To Know Axis – Podcast
company_description: Axis Communications is a global growth company with currently are about 4000 employees worldwide and offices in over 50 countries. We are expanding. Visit our webb page axis.com

title: Engineering Manager - Rich Messaging & Provisioning Architecture
description:
About Sinch
  
At Sinch, we power meaningful conversations at global scale. With over 147 billion interactions processed every year, our technology connects businesses to people across every mobile channel — SMS, RCS, WhatsApp, Viber, and more. With 4,500+ colleagues in 60+ countries, we are committed to building the most trusted, scalable, and innovative communication platform on earth.
  
We are strengthening our engineering leadership in Malmö and are seeking an Engineering Manager with strong architectural expertise and a proven track record in leading engineering organizations. This role combines people leadership with technical ownership — you will not only lead several high-performing development teams but also own the architecture and evolution of our provisioning platform, a critical foundation of our messaging business.
  
  

Role Overview
  
This is not a pure people-management role. As Engineering Manager, you will be both a strategic architect and a leader of leaders. Half of your focus will be on building and scaling world-class engineering teams, while the other half will be on shaping the architecture of our provisioning and messaging platforms to meet the demands of global scale, reliability, and security.
  
You will drive technical direction, make architecture decisions in collaboration with senior engineers and architects, and ensure provisioning systems integrate seamlessly with our messaging stack. Your leadership will ensure our teams are not only delivering today but are also building for the future.
  
  

Key Responsibilities
  
Technical & Architectural Leadership
  
* Own the Provisioning Architecture across the messaging domain, ensuring scalability, reliability, compliance, and automation.
* Define and evolve APIs, workflows, and data models for customer onboarding, provisioning, and lifecycle management.
* Partner with senior architects and engineers to design next-generation distributed systems running in the cloud.
* Provide technical guidance on microservice architectures, Kubernetes, Istio/service mesh, cloud-native design, and observability.
* Lead architectural reviews and make critical trade-offs balancing performance, cost, and scalability.


People & Organizational Leadership
  
* Lead and grow multiple engineering teams, ensuring alignment with product strategy and architectural vision.
* Build leadership capacity within your teams; mentor engineers and engineering managers to become future technical leaders.
* Foster a culture of technical excellence, knowledge sharing, and accountability.
* Own staffing, recruitment, and retention strategies for critical engineering roles.


Delivery & Execution
  
* Ensure architectural roadmaps are translated into actionable engineering plans.
* Balance short-term delivery of features with long-term architectural investments.
* Proactively identify and mitigate risks in mission-critical, high-availability systems.
* Maintain close collaboration with product management, security, compliance, and business stakeholders.


**Requirements:**  

* Education & Experience
* MSc in Computer Science, Engineering, or equivalent practical experience.
* Significant experience leading engineering organizations (50+ engineers, ideally across multiple teams).
* Track record of driving architectural evolution in large-scale distributed systems.
* Technical Expertise
* Deep knowledge of distributed systems, high-throughput transactional platforms, and global-scale SaaS/CPaaS.
* Hands-on experience with AWS or other cloud platforms, Kubernetes, and service meshes.
* Strong software engineering background (Typescript, NodeJS, React, Go, Java or similar), with ability to engage deeply in system design.
* Solid understanding of provisioning, identity management, and API-first architectures.
* Strong knowledge of security, compliance, and data protection requirements in telecom-scale systems.
* Leadership Skills
* Proven ability to grow and scale engineering teams while retaining technical depth.
* Excellent communication skills; able to bridge between executives, business stakeholders, and technical leaders.
* Fluent in English (Swedish a plus).


Nice to Have
  
* Experience with telecom provisioning systems or carrier-grade high-transaction platforms.
* Knowledge of messaging protocols (SMS, RCS, WhatsApp, etc.).
* Prior experience balancing architecture and people leadership in a high-growth SaaS or CPaaS company.


Our Hiring Process
  
We are committed to ensuring a recruitment process that is fair, objective, consistent, and inclusive. Our approach includes structured, competency-based interviews designed to evaluate your skills, experience, and qualifications relevant to the role. At times, we may include a data-driven assessment to enhance our hiring success and identify candidates likely to excel.
  
We believe in a two-way process and encourage you to ask questions throughout the journey. If this role isn't what you're looking for, please explore the other opportunities listed on our career page: . No matter who you are, we hope you find an exciting path forward - hopefully with us!
company_description: We help companies to communicate with customers via messaging, voice and video using multiple channels. Simplifying life by bringing all people and businesses together using technology is our purpose.

title: Nattreceptionist Scandic Alvik
description:
Scandic Alvik är ett hotell beläget i Alvik, endast 10 min från Stockholm city och ett stenkast från Mälaren. Vår ambition är att vara bäst på gästupplevelser. Hos oss ingår du i ett härligt team med engagerade medarbetare som hjälper varandra och sätter gästen i fokus i allt vi gör. Hotellet har en variation av gäster bestående av allt ifrån affärsresenärer, nyfikna turister till konferenssällskap. Älskar du att leverera oförglömlig service i världsklass och att skratta på arbetstid? Då passar du perfekt i vårt team!


**Nu söker vi en Nattreceptionist till Scandic Alvik 85%**

Ett varmt välkomnande ansikte kan göra stor skillnad för gästens upplevelse hos oss. Du agerar värd tillsammans med övriga teamet på hotellet och skapar en gästupplevelse i världsklass med ett stort säkerhetstänk.


Hos oss får du ta ett stort eget ansvar för att ta de beslut som krävs för att göra gästen nöjd och teamen utvecklar och förbättrar arbetssätt och service i takt med att omvärlden förändras Vi tror starkt på att vi överträffar gästernas förväntningar när du får möjlighet att växa och bidra med din fulla kompetens och erfarenhet. På vägen dit har vi dessutom roligt på jobbet.



Så ta med dig dina erfarenheter, ditt engagemang och ditt sätt att tänka till oss – och bidra till en kultur där vi bryr oss på riktigt: om varandra, våra gäster och vår planet. Välkommen till Scandic!


**Vad är innebär rollen?**

Som nattreceptionist är du ansvarig för att våra gäster får en lugn och trygg nattsömn. Du trivs med att vara vaken när andra sover. Du uppskattar att arbeta självständigt med satta rutiner, efter en checklista och ta egna beslut när det behövs. Du är den som ser till att gästens behov alltid sätts i fokus. Du är den som går igenom ankomstlistan och lägger tid på detaljerna. Ser till att gästens önskemål uppfylls. Du har alltid ett leende på läpparna och har alltid en kreativ lösning i bakfickan. Med en lösningsorienterad attityd hanterar du eventuella problem och förvandlar missnöjda gäster till nöjda. Din arbetsplats är vår lobby där du ansvarar för administrativa uppgifter, säkerhetsarbete och försäljning.



Under ditt shift arbetare du ensam på din avdelning, och är då ansvarig för säkerheten på hotellet.


Arbetet i receptionen innebär att checka in och ut hotellets gäster, hälsa välkommen och ge gästen den information den behöver om sin vistelse. Du använder systemet Opera Cloud för att hantera bokningar och administrativt arbete kring gäster och säkerhet. Allt arbete sker med gästnöjdhet och försäljning i fokus.


**Vem är du?**

För att passa i rollen tror vi att du har en väl utvecklad social förmåga och är kapabel att hantera att det händer många olika saker samtidigt. Det är mycket viktigt att du kan förmedla ett gott värdskap till hotellets gäster.


Du har också vana och kunskap i att arbeta med dator som arbetsredskap.


Goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska är ett krav och ytterligare språkkunskaper är meriterande. Du är en person som ser hur fokus på detaljer spelar stor roll i ditt dagliga arbete att leverera service.


Du är uppmärksam och lägger stor vikt vid säkerhetsfrågor.



**Information om tjänsten**



Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning på deltid.


Vi tar enbart emot ansökningar via vår hemsida. Alla ansökningar kommer att behandlas löpande och tjänsten kan tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdag, varför vi ber dig att ansöka så snart som möjligt. I denna rekrytering använder vi oss av ett enklare test om service vid urvalet.



Vi ser fram emot att välkomna dig till oss på Scandic!



Ps. på vår hemsida kan du läsa mer om vår kultur, vad tjänsten innebär och om våra förmåner!


  
**Vi har riktigt bra förmåner**
-------------------------------

Rabatt när du äter, dricker och övernattar hos oss


Family & Friends rabatt för din familj och vänner


Rabatt hos våra partnerföretag


Pension & försäkringar enligt kollektivavtal


Friskvårdsbidrag


Utbildning och utveckling via interna plattformar


  
Vi når längre när olikheter bejakas. Hos oss får du utrymme att vara dig själv och utvecklas i den riktning du vill, med trygga villkor och schyssta avtal som grund. Ta med dig dina erfarenheter, ditt engagemang och ditt sätt att tänka till oss - bidra till en kultur där vi bryr oss på riktigt: om varandra, våra gäster och vår planet. Välkommen till Scandic.



Delar du våra värderingar?


**BE A PRO** **BE YOU** **BE CARING** **BE BOLD**

  

  

...uppmuntrar alla att göra skillnad för miljön och att det var en av våra kollegor inom housekeeping som kom på idén om ”häng-upp-handduken”.
...i Sverige blivit rankad som besöksnäringens mest attraktiva arbetsgivare två år i rad, i Visitas årliga undersökning.
... bara serverar kaffe som är ekologiskt och Fairtrade eller UTZ-certifierat.
...tack vare vårt stora miljöengagemang, blivit rankad som branschens mest hållbara arbetsgivare elva år i rad, av Sustainable Brand Index.
...under 2014 inledde ett samarbete med organisationen Real Stars, centrerat kring ”Fair Sex”, dvs. arbete mot människo- och sexhandel.
company_addresses:
Scandic Hotels Deutschland GmbH
Gabriele-Tergit-Promenade 19
10963 Berlin

title: Receptionist Downtown Camper by Scandic
description:
Välkommen till ett inspirerande livsstilshotell med en atmosfär som främjar gemenskap, kreativitet, nyfikenhet och upptäckarglädje! Downtown Camper erbjuder inte bara nattsömn och god mat och dryck, utan allt från yoga till upptäcktsfärder och inspirationsföreläsningar. Här står mötet i fokus – mötet mellan natur och storstad, och mellan stockholmare och inresande. Vi vill att hotellet ska vara ett självklart basecamp för äventyrslystna upptäckare. Vi som arbetar på Downtown Camper i dag tycker vi har en rolig arbetsplats, fantastiska kollegor, bra ledarskap och en härlig atmosfär. Så är du en social, naturälskande storstadsmänniska? Då kan du vara den vi söker.
