title: AI Solutions Engineer
description:
**About Gilion:**
 Our mission is clear: We are accelerating founders in their growth journey through our Gilion platform. As a growing product company leveraging AI, we are creating an innovative, technically challenging platform revolutionizing how businesses grow - with the key of the platform being analytics, unique AI forecasting and equally as important; access to financing and funding, in a way never done before. Watch our platform here: gilion.com/platform
   

  

 Our team is made up of experts who have been part of leading companies like Spotify, Google, King, Sinch, bringing a wealth of experience and a passion for pushing boundaries. At Gilion, you’ll be part of a fast-moving, dynamic environment where your work will have a tangible impact on both our product and the industry as a whole. If you’re excited about working with challenging technology and making a real difference, Gilion is the place for you.
   

  

**About the Role:**
 You’ll bridge the gap between Gilion’s customers and our AI-driven analytics products. You will be building tools and services that make customers’ data accessible to an Analytics platform and AI agents for advanced credit and business analysis. In this role, you’ll also be spending time engaging directly with customers - onboarding them to our platform, ensuring their data quality, and making sure their integration is smooth and scalable as we grow.
   

  

* Lead customer onboarding from a technical perspective - guiding setup, integration, and data mapping and creating scalable solutions.
* Ensure high-quality, structured customer data that meets analysis requirements.
* Use and develop internal tools to clean, transform, and enrich data
* Collaborate with the product and engineering teams to build and improve data transformation tools and semantic layers.
* Work with AI agent orchestration (e.g. develop MCPs) to ensure agents have the right data and context to perform automated analyses.


**Background/Profile:**
* Strong understanding of data processing and integration
* Experience in backend development for building data transformation scripts/services.
* Strong interest in working with AI
* Excellent communication skills - able to explain technical concepts clearly to non-technical customers.
* Self-driven, adaptable, and eager to work in a fast-paced scaleup environment.


**What we offer:**
* Work-life balance, hybrid-remote model
* Diverse, inclusive and knowledge-sharing culture
* Experienced founders, backed by top investors
* A growth journey with tons of development opportunities
* AI product that impacts how companies grow, disrupting the industry

title: Product Manager - Work Management Tooling
description:
Spotify’s internal teams rely on a wide range of tools to collaborate, plan, and ship high-impact work. As a Product Manager in the Work Management Tooling area, you'll be responsible for crafting the vision and strategy for how Spotifiers manage the flow of work—from early ideation through to delivery and analysis. This space is broad, spanning developer needs, project planning, knowledge sharing, and data collaboration.
   

  

 We’re looking for a strongly opinionated product thinker—someone who can make strategic bets, drive clarity in a noisy space, and solve for diverse and evolving needs across engineering, product, design, and data teams. Your work will directly influence how thousands of Spotifiers plan, track, and improve their work across the organization.
   

  

 What You'll Do
   

  

* Define and own the product strategy and roadmap for the Work Management Tooling space, focusing on high-impact use cases such as:
* Developer iteration and version planning
* Project and portfolio management
* Multi-functional collaboration and documentation
* Workflows for data-driven decision making and experimentation
* Evaluate and shape the suite of tools used by teams—ranging from Jira, Confluence, Coda, and GitHub Projects to Airtable, DataHub, and more.
* Prioritize AI solutions that can scale and personalize across multiple agentic platforms and MCP servers
* Gather and synthesize requirements from a wide array of internal users including engineers, analysts, designers, researchers, and leadership.
* Establish and track metrics that reflect tool adoption, user satisfaction, operational efficiency, and collaboration health.
* Prioritize ruthlessly across competing needs, balancing technical feasibility with organizational value.
* Partner closely with engineering, internal platform teams, IT, and security to ensure scalable, secure, and user-friendly solutions.
* Lead change management, communication, and enablement efforts when introducing new tools or workflows.
* Stay attuned to industry trends in productivity tooling, enterprise collaboration platforms, and work automation.


 Who You Are
   

  

* Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Business, or a related field—or equivalent practical experience.
* 4+ years of product management experience, ideally in internal tools, SaaS collaboration platforms, or IT productivity ecosystems.
* Demonstrated success navigating broad, ambiguous product spaces with multiple stakeholder groups.
* Strong familiarity with modern work management tools (e.g., Jira, Asana, Linear, Notion, Confluence, GitHub Projects, Airtable, etc.)
* Experience designing for technical and non-technical audiences, particularly in developer and data-centric workflows.
* Strong analytical and strategic thinking; comfort making decisions with imperfect data.
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with a knack for driving alignment across complex organizations.
* Fluency in Agile/Scrum development practices.


 Where You'll Be
   

  

* This role is based in Toronto, London, or Stockholm.
* We offer you the flexibility to work where you work best! There will be some in person meetings, but still allows for flexibility to work from home.


 Spotify is an equal opportunity employer. You are welcome at Spotify for who you are, no matter where you come from, what you look like, or what’s playing in your headphones. Our platform is for everyone, and so is our workplace. The more voices we have represented and amplified in our business, the more we will all thrive, contribute, and be forward-thinking! So bring us your personal experience, your perspectives, and your background. It’s in our differences that we will find the power to keep revolutionizing the way the world listens.
   

  

 At Spotify, we are passionate about inclusivity and making sure our entire recruitment process is accessible to everyone. We have ways to request reasonable accommodations during the interview process and help assist in what you need. If you need accommodations at any stage of the application or interview process, please let us know - we’re here to support you in any way we can.
   

  

 Spotify transformed music listening forever when we launched in 2008. Our mission is to unlock the potential of human creativity by giving a million creative artists the opportunity to live off their art and billions of fans the chance to enjoy and be passionate about these creators. Everything we do is driven by our love for music and podcasting. Today, we are the world’s most popular audio streaming subscription service.

title: IT Service Manager – IAM
description:
We are seeking a
 **Temporary IAM Service Manager** 
 to support and strengthen our Identity and Access Management (IAM) capabilities. This consultancy assignment will focus on overseeing IAM service operations, managing vendor relationships, and ensuring the stability and performance of identity services across the organization.
   

  

**Start: 2025-09-01**
**End: 2025-12-31**
**Location: Stockholm, min 2 days/week onsite**
**Scope of Assignment**
 The consultant will be directly involved in the operational management of IAM services, with a strong focus on
 **Microsoft Entra, Active Directory** 
 , and other identity platforms. The role requires close collaboration with internal stakeholders, external vendors, and service teams to ensure IAM services are delivered effectively, securely, and in alignment with business requirements.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Oversee daily IAM service operations and ensure service stability.
* Manage and coordinate with external IAM service providers, ensuring agreed SLAs and KPIs are consistently met.
* Provide hands-on expertise in Microsoft Entra ID, Active Directory, AD FS, and AD-Connect.
* Drive and support incident, problem, and change management processes.
* Act as a key liaison between technical teams, business stakeholders, and external partners.
* Monitor and report on IAM service performance, identifying areas for improvement.
* Ensure IAM processes and operations support security and regulatory compliance requirements.


**Required Competencies**
* Proven hands-on experience with Microsoft Entra ID, Active Directory, AD FS, and AD-Connect.
* Strong background in IT service management, including incident, problem, and change management.
* Demonstrated vendor management skills and experience working with outsourced IAM service providers.
* Excellent stakeholder management and communication skills, with the ability to present technical and service performance updates to non-technical audiences.
* Solid understanding of IAM’s role in cybersecurity and compliance frameworks.
* Fluency in English and Swedish

title: IT Infrastructure Specialist (On-prem, Azure, M365)
company_industry: Banking, Financial Services, and Technology, Information and Media
description:
I takt med att vi utvecklar fler digitala tjänster till våra kunder spelar vårt skickliga infrateam en central roll i att säkerställa att infrastrukturen är robust, säker och redo för framtiden. Vi har just startat vår molnresa med Azure, vilket innebär att du blir en viktig del av att både forma vägen framåt och säkra driften i det som fortfarande är on-prem. När säkerhetskraven ökar och fler supportärenden kommer in behöver vi nu utöka teamet med en person för att säkra leveransen! Visst låter det spännande?
 



  





**Sista ansökningsdag:** 
 Just nu är vi på semester, men skicka gärna in din ansökan senast
 **31 augusti** 
 . Därefter bjuder vi in ett urval kandidater till en inledande telefonavstämning, följt av tester från Alva Labs.
 



  





**Hur kan en vanlig dag se ut, undrar du?** 




  




* En kopp nybryggt kaffe högst upp i Moodgallerian – du öppnar mejlen och kikar in i chatten
* Daily nummer 1 med Infra/Säkerhetsteamet.
* Daglig efterlevnadskontroll, t.ex. patch-status och Microsoft Secure Score.
* Påfyllning av kaffe.
* Möte med leverantör för att få till SSO-kopplingen till ett nytt system som ska integreras med Identity Access Manager.
* Daily nummer 2 med DevOps-teamet – ni diskuterar migrering från on-prem SQL till Azure SQL.
* Lunch med kollegorna.
* Ett klurigt ärende från servicedesk dyker upp – du löser det tillsammans med leverantören.
* En sista kopp kaffe.
* Arbetsmöte kring ett initiativ du driver för att flytta patchhantering från on-prem till Azure Update Manager.
* Granskning av ett leverantörsförslag – uppfyller det våra säkerhetskrav, teknisk design och funktion?
* Du svarar på några mejl och rundar av dagen.



  





**Vår miljö:** 




  





 Vår miljö är till stor del on-prem och driftas av extern partner. Vi utvärderar nu stegvis vilka infrastrukturella tjänster som kan flyttas till Azure – med fokus på säkerhet, automatisering och modern drift (IaC, Update Manager, Defender, ARC). Som exempel är vår Windows 11 klient helt molnbaserad.
 



  





**Och vem är du?** 




  





 Vi tror att du har gedigen erfarenhet av att arbeta med infrastruktur i komplexa miljöer och har ett starkt sinne för struktur, dokumentation och cybersäkerhet. Du har djupa kunskaper inom Azure, kan skriva script och har koll på Infrastructure as Code. I den bästa av världar har du varit med och drivit en liknande resa från on-prem till molnet – och trivs med att växla mellan nyutveckling i och förvaltning i både Azure och on-prem.
 



 Samarbete kommer för dig lätt och du är van att kravställa leverantörer. Med din erfarenhet är du självgående och van att prioritera, ta ansvar och eskalera vid behov. Du tar ägandeskap för både förvaltning och utveckling av vår infrastruktur.
 



  





 📌 Svenska i tal och skrift är vårt företagsspråk.
 



  





**Villkor:** 




  





 Tjänsten är på heltid placerad på vårt fina kontor mitt i stan, en plats för samarbete och kulturbyggande där vi träffas regelbundet varje vecka. Samtidigt har du självklart möjlighet att jobba på distans när det behövs. Vi värdesätter mångfald och tror att olika perspektiv och erfarenheter stärker både vårt team och vår arbetsplatskultur.
 



  





 Vi erbjuder fina förmåner såsom generöst friskvårdbidrag, mängder av trevliga personalaktiviteter mm. Är du den vi söker? Tveka inte att skicka in din ansökan redan idag!

title: Group Manager
description:
**Därför är detta jobb för dig**
 På Knightec Group är vi omtänksamma, vi vågar utmana och vi driver bolaget framåt tillsammans. I den här rollen får du möjlighet att kombinera affärsutveckling med ledarskap och bidra till Knightecs fortsatta tillväxt. Du drivs av att utveckla kundrelationer och bygga långsiktiga partnerskap, samtidigt som du rekryterar, inspirerar och utvecklar medarbetare.
   

  

 Vi erbjuder våra kunder spetskompetens och tjänster inom produktutveckling och innovation. Genom åren har vi etablerat starka kundrelationer inom en bredd av branscher, bland annat MedTech, fordon, försvar och industri.
   

  

 Du kommer att arbeta inom affärsområdet Software & Cloud, där vi hjälper kunder att utveckla framtidssäkra, storskaliga dator- och mjukvarusystem – från inbyggda system och elektronik till datadrivna företagsapplikationer, AI och molnbaserade lösningar.
   

  

**Arbetsuppgifter**
 Som Group Manager Kommer Du Att Ha En Central Roll i Att Driva Vår Tillväxt Och Utveckling Inom Software & Cloud i Stockholm. Dina Fokusområden Kommer Att Vara
   

  

* Kund- och affärsutveckling – genom att initiera och driva nya initiativ hos både befintliga och nya kunder skapar du värde, bygger långsiktiga partnerskap och gör Knightec Group till en självklar strategisk partner över tid.
* Medarbetarutveckling och rekrytering – du bygger och utvecklar ditt team genom nyrekrytering och genom att coacha och utveckla befintliga medarbetare.
* Ledarskap och kultur – du är en förebild som investerar i människor och bidrar till att forma en modern företagskultur där medarbetare inspireras, trivs och växer.


**Kvalifikationer**
 Vi Söker Dig Som Vill Kombinera Affärsutveckling Med Ledarskap Och Som Trivs i En Entreprenöriell Miljö. För Att Lyckas i Rollen Tror Vi Att Du Har
   

  

* Erfarenhet av att leda och utveckla andra, i roller där du haft ett tydligt ansvar för människor och team – och där du drivit både individers och gruppers utveckling.
* En teknisk bakgrund och förståelse för teknikens möjligheter – oavsett om du tidigare arbetat med mjukvara, elektronik, automation eller annan närliggande domän.
* Vana att arbeta nära affären genom kunddialoger, presentationer och relationsbyggande – och du trivs i rollen som en naturlig partner till kunden.
* En högskole- eller universitetsutbildning inom teknik eller IT.
* Förmåga att kommunicera obehindrat på svenska och engelska, i både tal och skrift.


**En spännande resa med Knightec Group**
 Semcon och Knightec har gått samman som Knightec Group. Tillsammans bildar vi Norra Europas ledande strategiska partner inom produkt- och digital tjänsteutveckling – hur häftigt är inte det?
   

  

 Med en unik kombination av tvärfunktionell expertis och en holistisk förståelse för affärer hjälper vi våra kunder att förverkliga sina strategier – från idé till färdig lösning. På Knightec Group finns kompetensen, attityden och drivkraften som krävs för att anta de mest utmanande och innovativa projekten.
   

  

 För våra medarbetare innebär detta fantastiska möjligheter att vara med och forma framtiden genom meningsfulla projekt i teknikens absoluta framkant. Här får du inte bara utvecklas och växa, utan också bli en del av något större.
   

  

 Låter det som platsen för dig? Häng med på en spännande resa!
   

  

**Praktisk information**
 Tjänsten är placerad på vårt kontor i Stockholm, Rättarvägen 3 (Solna United). Startdatum är så snart som möjligt eller enligt överenskommelse.
   

  

 Skicka in din ansökan så snart som möjligt, men senast 2025-09-18. Om du har några frågor om tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta Albert Lindfors, Talent Acquisition Partner. Observera att vi, på grund av GDPR, endast tar emot ansökningar via vår karriärsida.
   

  

 Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig!

title: Azurearkitekt
description:
*Redpill Linpro är ledande specialister inom open source och brinner för öppna lösningar, öppna affärsmodeller och ett öppet samhälle. Tillsammans samverkar vi för att uppnå maximal nytta för alla. Hos oss finns några av marknadens främsta experter inom sina specialområden. Vi är omkring 300 anställda och du finner oss i tre länder på sex kontor: Stockholm, Göteborg, Karlstad, Linköping samt i Köpenhamn och Oslo.*
**Vi är öppna – är du?**
 Är du redo att vara en del av framtidens molnlösningar? Vår verksamhet inom Azure Services växer, och vi söker nu efter fler underbara kollegor som brinner för att utveckla, designa och implementera systemlösningar i Azure!
   

  

 Som Azurearkitekt hos oss får du möjlighet att arbeta med både publika och privata molnlösningar där du kommer att ansvara för att utveckla lösningar på Azure-stacken. Arbetet kommer variera mellan olika plattformarna där integration kommer vara en återkommande del. På Redpill Linpro värdesätter vi samarbete och du kommer att arbeta nära andra kollegor för att göra en verklig skillnad för samhället, tillsammans med våra kunder.
   

  

 För att trivas i rollen känner du dig bekväm med att designa system som tar hänsyn till framtida förändringar. Du tänker proaktivt och har förståelse för att affärsprocesser ska tas hänsyn till innan du ger dig på tekniken. Vidare förstår du skillnaden mellan att jobba ”agilt” och att designa ett "agilt" system. Du vill lära dig nya saker och är bekväm med att ifrågasätta dina egna lösningar. Du frågar inte efter en färdig kravspecifikation men är villig att ta fram denna tillsammans med kunden.
   

  

**Som Azurearkitekt hos oss kommer du att arbeta med:**
* Ta fram krav tillsammans med kunden
* Identifiera ”core use-cases” utifrån framtagna krav
* Ta fram arkitektur på en konceptuell nivå och föreslå dens möjliga realiseringar
* Ta fram kostnadskalkyler och motivera val av tekniker
* Serverless teknologier
* Container lösningar
* Meddelandebaserade kommunikationsteknologier (ServiceBus, EventHub, etc)
* Diverse storage lösningar (SQL, Cosmos, Blob etc.)
* API design och livscykel
* DevOps
* C#, .NET, Typescript, Javascript eller Java


**Vem är du?**
 För att trivas som konsult hos oss är det viktigt att du har ett stort teknikintresse och en vilja att utveckla dig inom nya områden och ny teknik. Du drivs av problemlösning och delar värderingen att samarbete är det som tar oss framåt.
   

  

**Utöver detta ser vi att du uppfyller följande:**
* Har några års erfarenhet av utveckling, arkitektur eller liknande arbete
* Har goda kunskaper i både svenska och engelska
* Du har varit med/ansvarat för kommunikationen med affärssidan för att förstå vad det är för system man bygger och vem man bygger det för


**Meriter:**
* Du har gått kurser som ges av iDesign eller Barry O'Reilly på DF Kompetens.
* Du är certifierad arkitekt
* Du har tidigare suttit med konsultarbete eller tagit fram kravställning hos kunder


 Tveka inte att höra av dig om du vill arbeta med oss. Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!
   

  

 Redpill Linpro is the leading provider of Open Source services and products in the Nordics. We are located in seven offices with a mission to share knowledge and best practices for a more open society.
   

  

 We are passionate about open solutions, open business models, and an open society where we work together for maximum benefit to everyone. We have got some really skilled co-workers here at Redpill Linpro, particularly within our main areas: API management, development, IT operations, data analytics, customer experience, cloud, DevOps, and automation.
   

  

**May the Source be with you!**

title: Account Executive (New Business Sales) – Manufacturing, Logistics, Automotive, E&U + Retail, Consumer Goods and T&H
company_industry: IT Services and IT Consulting and Business Consulting and Services
description:
**Account Executive (New Business Sales) – Manufacturing, Logistics, Automotive, E&U + Retail, Consumer Goods and T&H Sectors**
**Location - Stockholm**
**Role Summary**
 This role will be aligned to Cognizant’s Products & Resources (MLEU + RCGTH) Business Unit, Cognizant is looking for an experienced “Account Executive” to join their new business sales team.
   

  

 As a new business Account Executive, you are an enterprise sales professional experienced in selling to and opening new logo accounts.
   

  

 Selling the full suite of Cognizant’s services and solutions, including market leading capabilities in Digital, Data, AI, and Cloud, etc, you know how to create value and drive business outcomes. This role will have responsibility for pursuing 10-15 targeted Accounts. Accounts will typically be oriented geographically to location but may include marquee accounts outside of Sweden. The Account Executive will work with a Client Partner and team that will support all sales pursuits and an offshore team will provide targeted marketing into designated accounts.
   

  

**Your Background**
* Demonstrable track record in new business / net new logo sales for a large Tier 1 or Tier 2 Global Systems Integrator
* Experience of working alongside and building relationships within major Manufacturing, Logistics, E&U + Retail, Consumer Goods and Travel & Hospitality organizations
* Experience of working for a Global Services Firm with onshore, nearshore and offshore capabilities.
* Knowledge and experience selling similar Services including Digital, Data, Cloud, Consulting and application modernization
* Demonstrable success selling multi million, multi-year deals.
* Demonstrable consecutive quarterly and yearly quota achievement in complex selling environments utilizing a solution selling model.


**Top Reasons To Join Our Team**
* Excellent compensation/benefits. A strong financial incentive package that includes a solid base salary with a highly attractive commissions plan.
* Wide exposure to industry, product and functional best practices; as well as world-class teams supporting your sales pursuits.
* Supportive management team that rewards initiative & success.
* Exciting, industry leading practice where you can truly build a long-term career.
* Congenial, collaborative, and success-oriented culture; the opportunity to work with and learn from a diverse, highly experienced team of business professionals. Tremendous opportunities for growth with a real career path promoting career advancement.


**A Good Fit For The Cognizant Culture**
 A person who possesses a true passion for changing organizations for the better, and desires to do so within a success-oriented, yet professional atmosphere filled with business professionals who all manifest a belief in partnership, innovation, and excellence. Our “Cultural Value Drivers” are well-known and clearly communicated within the organization: Open, Transparent, Driven, Empowered, Opportunity-Filled, Flexible & Collaborative.
   

  

**Cognizant**
 At Cognizant (Nasdaq: CTSH), we engineer modern businesses to improve everyday life because we're dedicated to making a lasting impact. We help our clients modernize technology, reimagine processes and transform experiences so they can stay ahead in our fast-changing world. Together, we're improving everyday life. See how at www.cognizant.com or @cognizant.

title: ICT Risk Officer – Cyber Security and Resilience
company_industry: Banking, Financial Services, and Legal Services
description:
Do you have a passion for cyber security, resilience and cyber risk management?
   

  

 In Swedbank you have the opportunity to:
   

  

* Develop Swedbank’s top-down approach to cyber risk and operational resilience, from a second line perspective, considering regulatory requirements, standards and best/practices (such as EU DORA, EBA guidelines, ISO 27001/5, Cobit, and TOGAF).
* Integrate the concept of cyber risk management in wider operational resilience domains and risk management framework, including controls, reference architecture, strategy, governance, processes.
* Collaborate with other subject matter experts to provide cutting-edge advice and support to first line on cyber risk, cyber security, security architecture, cloud adoption, AI risk, operational resilience, third party risk and business continuity.
* Independently assess, monitor and report on current and emerging risks on cyber, AI, ICT, third parties and business continuity/disruptions.
* Exercise credible challenge, validation and oversight on first line practices on cyber, ICT, third parties and business continuity-related risks and processes.
* Work closely together with first line of defence specialist units to keep cyber, ICT, third parties and business continuity-related risks within risk appetite.


 What is needed in this role:
   

  

* A bachelor's or master's degree computer science, business administration, law, cyber security, data, political science, or equivalent.
* At least 10 years of experience in the fields of cyber security, cyber resilience and/or cyber risk management.
* Hands-on experience from hybrid environments, security architecture and specialisation in domains such as modern identity and access management, information protection, endpoint security, network security, application security, data security, incident detect & response, and/or continuity/recovery.
* Hands-on experience in working with industry best-practices, reference architecture, and control frameworks, credentials/certifications are beneficial.
* Understanding of risk-, supervisory and regulatory landscape on operational resilience, security, governance, and operational risk management, from financial services- or other highly regulated industry.
* Business-value and outcome-driven approach with an interest in tech, resilience and security and keeping up to date with emerging trends, tech and threats.
* The ability to work strategically yet challenge details and communicate and interact with stakeholders throughout the organisation, specialists and executives alike, and being a trusted advisor and making sense of the complex.
* Self-reliant and methodological problem-solver that gets stuff done yet with a collaborative, curious and engaging approach


 With us, you can experience:
   

  

* Personal and professional growth through self-leadership and continuous development.
* Meaningful work that positively impacts our workplace, our customers, and society.
* An open and collaborative culture that encourages cross-functional teamwork and provides networking opportunities.
* A supportive and inclusive environment that promotes a balanced and sustainable work-life, with flexible working conditions when suitable for the role.
* Benefits such as our share based reward program Eken, company pension plan, employee offer for banking products, health insurance.


 "Join our team and...
   

  

 become part of a new team set out provide harmonized, forward-leaning advice and subject matter expertise, and exercise good governance and strong oversight to bring about a measurable high-level of operational resilience and low ICT risk exposure. Join a team of professional colleagues, who work together to deliver cutting-edge advice and oversight, maximize operational resilience, and to contribute to Swedbank's position in society and for financial stability." -
 **Sam Graflund Wallentin,** 
**your future manager.**
 We look forward to receiving your application by 05.09.2025.
   

  

**Location: Stockholm, Sundbyberg**
**Recruiting manager: Sam Graflund Wallentin**
 We may begin the selection during the application period, so we welcome your application as soon as possible.
   

  

*We have made our choice regarding recruitment media and therefore kindly decline contact with ad sellers or sellers of other recruitment services.*
****Swedbank does not discriminate anybody based on gender, age, sexual orientation or sexual identity, ethnicity, religion or disability – everybody is welcome.****

title: Senior Software Engineer
description:
**Create moments that matter. Decode the future.**
 At the Electrolux Group, a leading global appliance company, we strive every day to shape living for the better for our consumers, our people and our planet. We share ideas and collaborate so that together, we can develop solutions that deliver enjoyable and sustainable living.
   

  

 Come join us as you are. We believe diverse perspectives make us stronger and more innovative. In our global community of people from 100+ countries, we listen to each other, actively contribute, and grow together.
   

  

 Join us in our exciting quest to build the future home!
   

  

**All about the role:**
 Are you passionate about clean code, elegant architecture, and making an impact at a global scale? We’re looking for a Senior Software Engineer to join our high-performing core commerce team at Electrolux, where digital innovation drives everything we do.
   

  

 You’ll be a key player in the development of our brand-new, fully in-house commerce platform, built from the ground up using a fresh, modern tech stack and powered by over 60 microservices. This is your opportunity to shape the foundation of how Electrolux connects with millions of customers globally, from Europe and North America to our new frontiers in LATAM, APAC, and beyond.
   

  

**What you’ll do:**
* Develop distributed system architecture and system integration
* Design event-driven applications leveraging microservices architecture on cloud platform
* Carry out Model and assess complex IT solutions
* Work closely with platform engineers and other IT professionals to choose compatible design solutions
* Manage and comply with release management process
* Analyze the scope and expected organizational impact of information systems
* Evaluate existing systems and provide advice on how to meet organizational requirements
* Ensure that the technical components of the project are in sync with the business needs of the organization
* Ensure that information systems are secure from threat
* Provide advice on project design, project costs, and expected benefit
* Identifies technical debt and proactively recommends alternatives or improvements


**Who you are:**
* University degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or related subjects preferred
* 9+ years of work experience building applications
* Advanced understanding of IT infrastructure and enterprise architectures
* Proven experience with microservices-based architecture
* Proficiency in coding with modern OOP programming languages such as Java and Kotlin experience is a must
* API-first development experience
* Extensive experience with Cloud Computing (AWS preferrable)
* Expertise in any modern document-oriented database, with a preference for MongoDB
* Experience in developing components for Event-Driven Architecture, with a minimum of production-level experience
* Experience working in an agile environment with a focus on engineering practices like testing, continuous integration etc.
* Data Migration experience
* Good knowledge of virtualization
* Analytics mindset with critical thinking and problem-solving skills
* Fine knowledge of industry trends and emerging technologies
* Fluent in English


**Desirable**
* Mongo Cluster administration
* Terraform and Kubernetes


**Where you'll be:**
 This is a full-time position, based at our Global Headquarters in Stockholm/Stadshagen (Sweden)
   

  

**As part of Electrolux, we will continuously invest in you and your development. There are no barriers to where your career could take you.**
**Find out more on:** 
 ElectroluxGroup: https://www.linkedin.com/company/electrolux/life/lifeatelectrolux

title: Senior Data Engineer
description:
I
 **Stretch Beyond** 
 använder vi använder Microsofts väletablerade verktyg och tekniker för data och analytics till att utveckla lösningar som är hållbara över tid. Med dessa tar vi in, bearbetar och tillgängliggör data på ett strukturerat sätt enligt våra kunders behov och förväntningar. Centralt för oss är att vi tror att data också spelar en viktig roll i omställningen till mer hållbara affärsmodeller, och självklart ser du också potentialen i datadriven effektivisering.
   

  

 Hos oss kommer du kreativt få rita upp nya lösningar, förverkliga dem hands-on och se effekten av ditt arbete, som exempelvis mer energieffektiva sjukhus. Du kan förvänta dig en arbetsplats i högt tempo där du får ta stort eget ansvar i omväxlande och utmanande åtaganden där vi hjälper varandra att skapa de bästa lösningarna för våra kunder.
   

  

 Om du vill vara med i början av ett nytt geografiskt område i ett väletablerat konsultbolag finns här en riktig möjlighet att bidra med din djupa kompetens. Du får vara med från grunden men har tryggheten och den sociala samvaron som är en självklarhet i Stretchgruppen. Vi erbjuder dig en naturlig plats i vardagen och möjligheten att göra skillnad.
   

  

 Hos oss är det okej med flexibilitet, vi sitter gärna tillsammans med våra syskonbolag på Gamla Brogatan 26 eller ute hos kund men samarbetar väl digitalt också.
   

  

 För den här rollen behöver du behärska både engelska och svenska samt ha flerårig erfarenhet av att arbeta med Microsofts verktyg.
   

  

**Vi tror att du som person...**
* Är en noggrann problemlösare som inte ger dig
* Gillar tekniska utmaningar
* Intresserar dig för ny teknik
* Vill både dela med dig av din kunskap och lära av andra
* Uppskattar högt tempo


**Erfarenheter som hjälper dig att lyckas i denna roll...**
* Datahantering i Azure, Synapse, Databricks, Fabric eller motsvarande
* Spark
* Power BI
* Avancerad SQL
* Python
* Relevant utbildning och längre arbetslivserfarenhet
* Konsulterfarenhet och/eller projekterfarenhet


 Läs gärna mer om oss här.
   

  

 Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!
   

  

 Hälsar teamet på Stretch Beyond

title: Jobba extra på Ada Digital som Talent Agent
description:
**Vågar du prova det oprövade? Ser du lösningar där andra ser problem? Välkommen som Talent Agent på deltid hos oss på Ada Digital.**
 Ada Digital i Stockholm söker nu en Talent Agent för att jobba extra minst 2 dagar i veckan. Vi är specialister på rekrytering, konsulter och talangprogram inom IT och digital utveckling. Och vi vet att för att lyckas så behöver man jobba på ett annat sätt. Tänka om. Och göra tvärtom. Gillar du att behöva använda både pannbenet och det som finns bakom det är rollen som Talent Agent rätt för dig. Och oroa dig inte om du inte vet vad en MDM Developer, Data Engineer eller Cloud-arkitekt gör och vad de taggar igång på – det lär du dig hos oss.
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig**
 Här Blir Du Del Av En Organisation Som Är Liten Nog Att Vara Enkel Att Påverka Framåt Och Som Samtidigt Erbjuder Trygghet Och Utvecklingsmöjligheter. Vi Erbjuder Dig
   

  

* Ett flexibelt och långsiktigt extrajobb vid sidan av dina studier
* Att arbeta med kunder, stora som små och välkända som mindre välkända, inom en väldigt stor bredd av branscher och inriktningar
* Ett agilt, datadrivet och digitalt arbetssätt med fokus på både teamwork och kontinuerliga förbättringar
* Ett av de absolut roligaste ansvaren i vår process: att kartlägga, hitta, approchera och attrahera kandidater och vara med från första kontakt till signerat avtal.


**Det här gör du hos oss**
 Du Arbetar Brett Över Hela Vår Process Men Med Ett Fokus På Search, Där Du Använder Digitala Verktyg Och Sociala Medier För Att Nå Ut Till Kandidater Som Inte Är Aktivt Arbetssökande. Du Kommer
   

  

* Vara med på uppstartsmöten med rekryterande chefer hos våra kunder, där du tillsammans med ansvarig rekryterare eller konsultansvariga ringar in kompetens- och attraktionsprofil
* Skriva pitchar och annonser där du lyfter fram det unika i varje tjänst
* Att stötta våra Talent Business Partners i att hantera search, ansökningar, referenstagningar, intervjuer och bakgrundskontroller
* Att säkerställa en fantastisk kandidatupplevelse!


**Ditt team och arbetsplats**
 Du blir del av ett engagerat företag och arbetar tätt tillsammans med alla våra Talent Business Partners. Vi har alla olika bakgrunder och erfarenheter – vissa av oss har jobbat med rekrytering innan och vissa har lärt sig området hos oss.
   

  

 Vi sitter tillsammans med vårt moderbolag TNG bredvid Mall of Scandinavia och Solna Station. Hos oss är det kort sträcka (från pendeltåget till stationen, och) från idé till genomförande och vi har en genomgående positiv energi. Vi jobbar tre dagar i veckan på kontoret.
   

  

**Mer om dig**
 Vi söker dig som studerar, exempelvis personalvetenskap, på eftergymnasial nivå och som har minst 1,5 år kvar av dina studier. Våra arbetsspråk är både svenska och engelska, och du behärskar båda språken mycket väl i tal och skrift. Erfarenhet av rekrytering, search och IT-branschen är meriterande.
   

  

 Som person och kollega är du kommunikativ, resultatorienterad och initiativtagande. Du är nyfiken, motiverad och kan växla fokus när det behövs – vi jobbar med flera uppdrag och processer parallellt och din vardag kommer vara mycket varierad!
   

  

 Vi söker också såklart dig som vill utveckla dina kunskaper på lång sikt hos oss, och som har ett genuint intresse för IT och Tech. Vi på Ada Digital är inspirerade av matematikern Ada Lovelace – världens första programmerare. Hon var begåvad, motiverad, nyfiken och tänkte på ett annorlunda sätt än övriga samtida matematiker gjorde. Vi förväntar oss inte att du som hon ska revolutionera samtiden men ha samma tankesätt och nyfikenhet!
   

  

**Så här får vi kontakt**
 På Ada Digital strävar vi efter en transparent, inkluderande och snabbrörlig rekryteringsupplevelse. Och vi vill veta mer om dig och din potential! Du söker tjänsten enkelt och behöver inte bifoga några dokument. Det räcker med en motivering till varför du söker tjänsten och om du saknar CV kan du bifoga din LinkedIn-profil. Följ sedan din ansökan live via vår hemsida. Urvalet sker löpande och tjänsten kan bli tillsatt före sista ansökningsdatum. Är du nyfiken och vill veta mer innan du söker? Hör av dig till ansvarig rekryterare. Vi ser fram emot att få kontakt med dig!

title: Group Manager
description:
**Därför är detta jobb för dig**
 På Knightec Group är vi omtänksamma, vi vågar utmana och vi driver bolaget framåt tillsammans. I den här rollen får du möjlighet att kombinera affärsutveckling med ledarskap och bidra till Knightecs fortsatta tillväxt. Du drivs av att utveckla kundrelationer och bygga långsiktiga partnerskap, samtidigt som du rekryterar, inspirerar och utvecklar medarbetare.
   

  

 Vi erbjuder våra kunder spetskompetens och tjänster inom produktutveckling och innovation. Genom åren har vi etablerat starka kundrelationer inom en bredd av branscher, bland annat MedTech, fordon, försvar och industri.
   

  

 Du kommer att arbeta inom affärsområdet Software & Cloud, där vi hjälper kunder att utveckla framtidssäkra, storskaliga dator- och mjukvarusystem – från inbyggda system och elektronik till datadrivna företagsapplikationer, AI och molnbaserade lösningar.
   

  

**Arbetsuppgifter**
 Som Group Manager Kommer Du Att Ha En Central Roll i Att Driva Vår Tillväxt Och Utveckling Inom Software & Cloud i Stockholm. Dina Fokusområden Kommer Att Vara
   

  

* Kund- och affärsutveckling – genom att initiera och driva nya initiativ hos både befintliga och nya kunder skapar du värde, bygger långsiktiga partnerskap och gör Knightec Group till en självklar strategisk partner över tid.
* Medarbetarutveckling och rekrytering – du bygger och utvecklar ditt team genom nyrekrytering och genom att coacha och utveckla befintliga medarbetare.
* Ledarskap och kultur – du är en förebild som investerar i människor och bidrar till att forma en modern företagskultur där medarbetare inspireras, trivs och växer.


**Kvalifikationer**
 Vi Söker Dig Som Vill Kombinera Affärsutveckling Med Ledarskap Och Som Trivs i En Entreprenöriell Miljö. För Att Lyckas i Rollen Tror Vi Att Du Har
   

  

* Erfarenhet av att leda och utveckla andra, i roller där du haft ett tydligt ansvar för människor och team – och där du drivit både individers och gruppers utveckling.
* En teknisk bakgrund och förståelse för teknikens möjligheter – oavsett om du tidigare arbetat med mjukvara, elektronik, automation eller annan närliggande domän.
* Vana att arbeta nära affären genom kunddialoger, presentationer och relationsbyggande – och du trivs i rollen som en naturlig partner till kunden.
* En högskole- eller universitetsutbildning inom teknik eller IT.
* Förmåga att kommunicera obehindrat på svenska och engelska, i både tal och skrift.


**En spännande resa med Knightec Group**
 Semcon och Knightec har gått samman som Knightec Group. Tillsammans bildar vi Norra Europas ledande strategiska partner inom produkt- och digital tjänsteutveckling – hur häftigt är inte det?
   

  

 Med en unik kombination av tvärfunktionell expertis och en holistisk förståelse för affärer hjälper vi våra kunder att förverkliga sina strategier – från idé till färdig lösning. På Knightec Group finns kompetensen, attityden och drivkraften som krävs för att anta de mest utmanande och innovativa projekten.
   

  

 För våra medarbetare innebär detta fantastiska möjligheter att vara med och forma framtiden genom meningsfulla projekt i teknikens absoluta framkant. Här får du inte bara utvecklas och växa, utan också bli en del av något större.
   

  

 Låter det som platsen för dig? Häng med på en spännande resa!
   

  

**Praktisk information**
 Tjänsten är placerad på vårt kontor i Stockholm, Rättarvägen 3 (Solna United). Startdatum är så snart som möjligt eller enligt överenskommelse.
   

  

 Skicka in din ansökan så snart som möjligt, men senast 2025-09-18. Om du har några frågor om tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta Albert Lindfors, Talent Acquisition Partner. Observera att vi, på grund av GDPR, endast tar emot ansökningar via vår karriärsida.
   

  

 Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig!

title: Nordic Technology Operating Model Manager
description:
Deloitte is a leading global provider of Audit & Assurance, Tax & Legal, and Consultative Services. With more than 457,000 professionals in over 150 countries, we help our clients and society to solve complex problems and achieve ambitious goals. We are driven by one purpose: to make an impact that matters. To us, this means lasting results for our clients and their businesses, ideas and actions that contribute to a greater good. It also means empowering our people and supporting them in their growth journey.
   

  

  




**Job Description**

 We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced manager for our Technology Compliance and Risk Management process in the Nordics. This senior role requires extensive experience in compliance and risk management, crucial for driving our Technology Operating Model with an emphasis on regulatory adherence and risk mitigation. You will ensure our standards are met when implementing new technologies and maintaining existing ones, focusing on compliance and risk management.
   

  

  





 The position is based in Stockholm and is part of Internal IT, collaborating with other business units across Deloitte in the Nordics. You will work in a dynamic environment with leadership support locally and regionally, balancing technical and talent management. Your technical leader will be in Copenhagen, and your talent leader will be in Stockholm.
   

  

  





  

  

  





**Key Responsibilities in the role;**




 Compliance and Risk Management:
   

  

  




* Manage and maintain IT solutions repository of compliant solutions.
* Identify and mitigate risks associated with the Technology Operating Model (TOM).
* Enforce policies and procedures for technology management with a focus on compliance.
* Ensure alignment with regulatory requirements and industry standards.


 Governance:
   

  

  

* Drive and maintain a backlog and pipeline of TOM assessments requested.
* Establish governance frameworks to support compliance and risk management.


 Performance Improvement:
   

  

  

* Continuously improve technology processes to enhance efficiency and effectiveness.
* Establish key performance indicators (KPIs) and metrics to monitor and report on compliance and risk management performance.
* Use data-driven insights to inform decision-making and drive improvements.


**Qualifications**

 We are looking for candidates who have:
   

  

  




* Bachelor's degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, or a related field (Master's degree preferred).
* Extensive experience in technology operations management, with a strong focus on compliance and risk management, essential for this senior profile role.
* Proven track record in risk management, governance, and compliance in technology operations.
* Excellent interpersonal skills.
* Competency mix of both business and technology skills and the ability to broker between technical people and business people.
* Ability to develop and execute plans and roadmaps.
* Strong communicator.


 Desired Skills:
   

  

  

* Ability to manage multiple projects and priorities simultaneously.
* Experience in stakeholder management.
* Familiarity with solution architecture, hosting/cloud, cyber security, and compliance.
* Understanding of ITIL frameworks and best practices.


**Additional Information**

**Why Deloitte is a Great Place to Work:**



* Global Network: Deloitte offers a vast global network, providing opportunities for international collaboration and exposure to diverse perspectives.
* Professional Development: We are committed to your professional growth, offering extensive training programs, mentorship, and career development opportunities.
* Inclusive Culture: Deloitte fosters an inclusive and collaborative workplace where we value diversity.
* Impactful Work: At Deloitte, you will work on meaningful projects that make a difference to our employees.
* Work-Life Balance: We understand the importance of work-life balance and offer flexible working arrangements to support your well-being.


  

  

  


**Application**




 You apply online. Your application should consist of:
   

  

  




* CV
* A motivation for why you are interested in the role


 We welcome your application before the deadline on 7th of September, 2025. Please do not wait until the last day to apply, as we may fill the position earlier due to our ongoing evaluation of candidates.
   

  

  


 As a qualitative step in Deloitte's recruitment process, our final candidates undergo a background check to increase knowledge about our future employees, ensure a safe working environment for our employees, and meet regulatory requirements. The background check process is conducted in collaboration with ToFindOut. https://tofindout.se/sv/faq/
   

  

  





  

  

**Questions**




 If you have questions about the position, you are welcome to contact Kristoffer Kaspersen (kkaspersen@deloitte.dk). For questions about the recruitment process, you are warmly welcome to contact Beatrice Magnusson, responsible recruiter at Deloitte (bmagnusson@deloitte.se).
   

  

  





 We look forward to your application!
   

  

  





**What impact will you make?**




 Every day, your work will make an impact that matters, while you thrive in a dynamic culture of inclusion, collaboration and high performance. We do not just aspire to make solutions. We wish to create an impact that makes a positive and crucial difference for the people around us, our clients and our society. Deloitte is where you’ll find unlimited opportunities to succeed and realize your full potential.

title: Account Manager, Sweden Public Sector
description:
***This job is with Amazon, an inclusive employer and a member of myGwork – the largest global platform for the LGBTQ+ business community. Please do not contact the recruiter directly.***
**Description**
 AWS Sales, Marketing, and Global Services (SMGS) is responsible for driving revenue, adoption, and growth from the largest and fastest growing small- and mid-market accounts to enterprise-level customers including public sector. The AWS Global Support team interacts with leading companies and believes that world-class support is critical to customer success. AWS Support also partners with a global list of customers that are building mission-critical applications on top of AWS services.
   

  

 As Account Executive you will have the exciting opportunity to help drive the growth and shape the future of an emerging technology and increase adoption and market segment presence of AWS in the Swedish Public Sector.
   

  

 The ideal candidate will possess both a sales / account management and technical background that enables them to drive an engagement at the executive level as well as with software developers and IT architects and have gained experience in the Public Sector in particular with Central Government. You will be a self-starter who is prepared to develop and execute against a territory coverage plan and consistently deliver results.
   

  

 You are an exceptionally strong and creative thinker who thrives in a team environment and embraces all aspects of selling and who is prepared to develop and execute against a territory coverage plan and consistently deliver on targets. You enjoy working in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.
   

  

 Key job responsibilities
   

  

* Effectively engage C-level business & technical executives within the assigned Customers
* Leverage executive Customer relationships to build trust with AWS leadership & accelerate strategic enterprise opportunities to ensure customer satisfaction
* Build/Own the strategic plan for the Customer you own, to drive business growth objectives
* Articulate compelling value propositions around AWS services
* Achieve goals and strategic objectives including revenue, pipeline and repeatable solutions
* Drive Customer strategy using industry vertical solutions, business transformation initiatives and deliver high quality Customer outcomes
* Work with cross functional teams & Partners to create and execute on strategic business plans, practice development and marketing, to execute achievement against Customers goals
* Help to drive business growth and expansion in a defined territory
* Manage numerous Customers concurrently & long-term
* Accelerate customer adoption & develop long-term strategic relationships with key accounts
* Travel as necessary


**About The Team**
 Diverse Experiences
   

  

 Amazon values diverse experiences. Even if you do not meet all of the preferred qualifications and skills listed in the job description, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasn't followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don't let it stop you from applying.
   

  

 Why AWS
   

  

 Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world's most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating - that's why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses.
   

  

 Work/Life Balance
   

  

 We value work-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why we strive for flexibility as part of our working culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there's nothing we can't achieve in the cloud.
   

  

 Inclusive Team Culture
   

  

 Here at AWS, it's in our nature to learn and be curious. Our employee-led affinity groups foster a culture of inclusion that empower us to be proud of our differences. Ongoing events and learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences, inspire us to never stop embracing our uniqueness.
   

  

 Mentorship and Career Growth
   

  

 We're continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth's Best Employer. That's why you'll find endless knowledge-sharing, mentorship and other career-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better-rounded professional.
   

  

**Basic Qualifications**
* Significant Account management experience for Enterprise and Public Sector Customers in the IT industry
* Substantial technology related sales, business development or sales engineering/consulting experience, gained within Enterprise and Public Sector Customers
* Strong presentation skills and ability to articulate complex concepts to cross-functional audiences
* BA/BS degree or equivalent experience required
* Strong verbal and written communications skills; fluent in Swedish and English


**Preferred Qualifications**
* Strong knowledge and focus on the Swedish Central Government
* A technical background in engineering, computer science, or MIS a plus.
* IaaS/PaaS/SaaS/Cloud experience
* Business acumen and passion
* Proven track record of taking ownership and successfully delivering results in a fast-paced, dynamic environment


 Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy\_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.
   

  

 Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how-we-hire/accommodations for more information. If the country/region you're applying in isn't listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner.

title: Development and Quality Engineering Lead - Find My Team, Malmo,
description:
Have you ever misplaced your phone, needed to locate your AirPods, or shared your location with family members? Apple Find My is a powerful and intuitive solution to locate and keep track of your Apple devices, your personal belongings, and the people in your life you care most about. The Find My team continues to drive innovation to expand our global product offerings while leveraging Apple’s growing ecosystem of devices and accessories. As an integral part of Apple’s hardware and software products, Find My is an early adopter of emerging technologies that enhance existing experiences or enable brand new capabilities across all supported platforms. We constantly seek to improve finding experiences and become a part of our user’s daily life while committing to Apple’s strict privacy promise. If you are you a self-starter looking for an exciting career opportunity and dream of shipping software solutions that impact millions of Apple users around the world, then this is the job for you. The Find My team is looking for an experienced lead software engineer who is equally passionate about software development and software quality. This unique opportunity requires a balanced approach to delivering complex engineering projects with a team of highly skilled software and quality engineers in a satellite office.
  

  

**Description**  

  

As the lead engineer, your responsibilities will include working closely with our vendors to staff both the developer and QE teams, act as the technical point of contact for contractors, take ownership of problems and deliverables, lead quality engineering efforts, and organize engineering tasks to deliver the next generation of Find My features. You will be working closely with multi-functional teams, across several continents, to optimally coordinate the sophisticated interdependencies inherent to our ecosystem. Creative thinking, strong problem solving, excellent communication skills and the ability to collaborate with other multi-functional teams in a dynamic setting are meaningful attributes which will serve you well in this role.
  

  

**Responsibilities**  

* Lead and drive the work of a team of remarkably skilled software engineers
* Be a strong advocate for the customer experience
* Take ownership of solving problems and deliver solutions on time
* Communicate and coordinate with teams and stakeholders in the US
* Participate in design and code reviews
* Assist with various team and system support needs
Assist in staffing requirements  
* 

  

  

**Minimum Qualifications**  

* Ability to take ownership, identify requirements, prioritise and make progress in an environment with limited given input.
* Very strong in leading others and hands-on, in programming, system design and problem solving
* Strong Swift expertise - including but not limited to: Multithreading, non-blocking IO
* Strong understanding of QA methodologies including triaging, debugging, automating, testing
* Experience driving release decisions, scoping work, and driving bug convergence Creating innovative ways to automate and expand our software testing
* Experience in cross team collaboration and communication across multiple timezones

  

**Preferred Qualifications**  

* Strong understanding of common data structures and basic graph algorithms and hands on experience writing strong object-oriented code including creating automation frameworks and test scripts for large scale testing scenarios
* Experience in C, C++ and working knowledge of cryptography standards and protocols (e.g.. PKCS, KMIP, X.509, AES, KDF, CA)
* Experience in collaborating with distributed engineering teams
Experience in the AI/ML domain  
* 

  

  

Submit Resume

title: Production System Engineer
description:
The Role
  
In this role, you will develop, maintain, and optimize local tools to reduce manual work, minimize operational errors, and support scalable processes, while redesigning systems to enhance user experience and tool robustness. You will handle complex escalated inquiries, review team outputs for quality, and ensure systems align with organizational standards. The role involves communicating with users to resolve issues, implementing quality assurance processes, conducting audits, and providing feedback for continuous improvement. Additionally, you will create reports and dashboards to visualize KPIs, supporting operational efficiency and shop floor productivity.
  
What you’ll do
  
Tech Support
  
Meet all system KPIs, including hardware, inventory control, warehouse tech, and data/system configurations.
  
Provide 3rd-level troubleshooting, define escalation and incident management processes, and support team data needs.
  
  

Process Improvement
  
Analyze data from multiple sources to identify trends, patterns, and opportunities for data-driven decisions.
  
Define and optimize process requirements for warehouse systems, implementing improvements and collaborating cross-functionally.
  
  

Maintenance
  
Ensure minimal system downtime with adherence to preventive and corrective maintenance procedures.
  
Create checklists, manage hardware controls, and coordinate procurement to maintain operational continuity.
  
  

Project Support
  
Coach and support team members in resolving data and system-related issues effectively.
  
Contribute to OpeX, FSQA, business expansion, and special fulfillment projects, driving operational improvements.
  
  

You have
  
Advanced hardware and software troubleshooting across warehouse and operational systems.
  
Strong data analysis skills, interpreting trends to support business decisions and process improvements.
  
Experience defining and implementing escalation, incident management, and preventive maintenance processes.
  
Ability to create tools, automate workflows, and optimize operational efficiency.
  
Proven track record supporting cross-functional projects, OpeX/FSQA initiatives, and business expansion efforts.
  
Excellent coaching, problem-solving, and communication skills for technical and non-technical audiences.
company_description: HelloFresh is a global food solutions group and the world's leading meal kit delivery company, active in 17 countries across 3 continents. Our kits include fresh ingredients and cooking instructions.

title: Senior Automation Engineer
description:
*We’re looking for a*
Senior Automation Engineer*Every day, we get opportunities to make a positive impact – on our colleagues, partners, customers and society. Together, we’re pioneering the solutions of the future and unlocking the full potential of precious resources. Trusted to act on initiative, we challenge conventional thinking to develop world-leading technologies that inspire progress in vital areas, including energy, food, water and shipping.*  

  

*As we push forward, the innovative, open spirit that fuels our 140-year-old start-up culture and rapid growth also drives our personal growth. So, as we shape a more resourceful, less wasteful world, we build our careers too.*
About the job
In this role as a Senior Automation Engineer, you will be an important part of our Automation Solutions team within the Smart Separator Systems department. You will work closely with colleagues across business areas and separator applications — from food and marine to life science projects.
This is a hands-on, senior engineering role where you will design, program, and develop automation systems for industrial processes, often in complex and demanding environments. You will contribute to standardising our software structures across applications, supporting innovation and future-ready solutions. You will also play an active role in knowledge-sharing and coaching less experienced colleagues, helping the whole team grow. Key responsibilities will include:* Develop and program control systems for automated industrial processes.
* Work with Model-Based Design (e.g., Simulink, MATLAB, Embedded Coder) to set up process control and generate code.
* Apply version control and revision management tools (e.g., Git) in your daily work.
* Support standardisation of automation structures across applications and projects.
* Collaborate closely in a flat, international team environment where knowledge-sharing is key.
* Contribute to innovation and continuous improvement, exploring new tools, trends, and future solutions.
* Support troubleshooting and root-cause analysis for customer issues, both remotely and onsite when needed.
* Add value in related areas such as Cybersecurity and Connected Services where possible.


Who you are
You are a collaborative and driven automation engineer who enjoys both the technical depth of programming and the broader view of system architecture. You are comfortable working in an open, team-oriented environment, where ideas are valued regardless of seniority. You enjoy solving problems creatively and have the confidence to guide projects forward while staying hands-on with the work.
What you know* Solid experience in automation engineering for industrial processes (preferably process industry or similar).
* Proficiency with PLC programming and experience with tools such as MATLAB/Simulink/Embedded Coder. Experience in C programming is considered advantageous.
* Familiarity with control systems like Siemens S7, B&R, Allen Bradley.
* Understanding of Model-Based Design principles.
* Understanding of process automation standards.
* Experience with version control/revision management (Git).
* Awareness of Cybersecurity in industrial automation (a plus).
* Relevant degree in Software, Automation, or equivalent.
* Fluent in English, both written and spoken (team language).


What’s in it for you?
We offer a challenging position in an open, friendly, and global environment where we help each other to develop and create value. Your work will directly influence the performance and reliability of systems used worldwide, with the possibility to make a big impact on our business unit’s future success.
For more information, please contact
Johanna Engström, Manager, Automation Solutions, johanna.engstrom@alfalaval.com
Richa Sethi, Talent Acquisition Partner, richa.sethi@alfalaval.com
For union information, please contact:
Anders Jansson, Unionen, anders.jansson@alfalaval.com
Axel Schäring, Akademikerna, axel.scharing@alfalaval.com
We will review applications continually, and we encourage you to please send in your application as soon as possible, no later than September 7th, 2025, through our career page https://career.alfalaval.com/jobs/search.*GDPR Compliant**Applications sent directly via email will be disregarded without notice.**Our commitment to integrity**We care about diversity, inclusion, and equity in our recruitment processes. We also believe behavioral traits can provide important insights into a candidate's fit to a role. To help us achieve this, we apply Pymetrics assessments. Upon application, you will be invited to play the assessment games and completing them is mandatory.**As part of our commitment to maintaining a safe and secure workplace, we conduct background checks on final candidates for this role.*

title: Software Security Engineer
description:
**Software Security Engineer**
------------------------------


Are you an engineer with an interest in security? Do you keep up to date with all the latest CVE reports? Do you like structure and making sure that your product is being shipped with the highest security standards? We are looking for a highly motivated and skilled Software Security Engineer to join our team.

**Meet the Team**
-----------------


We develop several products, and our team is composed of experienced and talented engineers with extensive backgrounds in computer science, functional programming, Linux, and many other technical areas. We work with agile methodologies to innovate in the network automation field.

**Roles and responsibilities**
------------------------------


You will be supporting multiple development teams within the engineering organization, focusing on the security of NSO (network orchestration and automation), CWM (workflow), and Foresight (AI agents). You should be comfortable working in a Linux environment and have experience from development. You will also have responsibility for the organizational process and compliance with the company software requirements. This includes internal requirements, threat models, as well as day-to-day support to managers and developers.

**Your Impact**
---------------

* Create and maintain the security surrounding the above products.
* Work directly with stakeholders for requirements gathering, execution, and development goals
* Deliver high quality products with security as top-of-mid.
* Participate in security code reviews
* Own the security surrounding development and release of the products

**Minimum Qualifications**
--------------------------

* Bachelor’s degree or higher in Computer Science or related field, or equivalent work experience
* Experience in security work for commercial products
* Proficient in Unix/Linux development
* Knowledge of security tools

**Preferred****Qualifications**
-------------------------------

* Security certifications
* Experience from the security community (forums, open-source projects, etc.)
* Ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment

Good communication skills in Swedish and English  
* 

  

#WeAreCisco where every individual brings their unique skills and perspectives together to pursue our purpose of powering an inclusive future for all.


Our passion is connection—we celebrate our employees’ diverse set of backgrounds and focus on unlocking potential. Cisconians often experience one company, many careers where learning and development are encouraged and supported at every stage. Our technology, tools, and culture pioneered hybrid work trends, allowing all to not only give their best, but be their best.


We understand our outstanding opportunity to bring communities together and at the heart of that is our people. One-third of Cisconians collaborate in our 30 employee resource organizations, called Inclusive Communities, to connect, foster belonging, learn to be informed allies, and make a difference. Dedicated paid time off to volunteer—80 hours each year—allows us to give back to causes we are passionate about, and nearly 86% do!


Our purpose, driven by our people, is what makes us the worldwide leader in technology that powers the internet. Helping our customers reimagine their applications, secure their enterprise, transform their infrastructure, and meet their sustainability goals is what we do best. We ensure that every step we take is a step towards a more inclusive future for all. Take your next step and be you, with us!


  
**Message to applicants applying to work in the U.S. and/or Canada:**  

  

When available, the salary range posted for this position reflects the projected hiring range for new hire, full-time salaries in U.S. and/or Canada locations, not including equity or benefits. For non-sales roles the hiring ranges reflect base salary only; employees are also eligible to receive annual bonuses. Hiring ranges for sales positions include base and incentive compensation target. Individual pay is determined by the candidate's hiring location and additional factors, including but not limited to skillset, experience, and relevant education, certifications, or training. Applicants may not be eligible for the full salary range based on their U.S. or Canada hiring location. The recruiter can share more details about compensation for the role in your location during the hiring process.
U.S. employees have **access** to quality medical, dental and vision insurance, a 401(k) plan with a Cisco matching contribution, short and long-term disability coverage, basic life insurance and numerous wellbeing offerings.


Employees receive up to twelve paid holidays per calendar year, which includes one floating holiday (for non-exempt employees), plus a day off for their birthday. Non-Exempt new hires accrue up to 16 days of vacation time off each year, at a rate of 4.92 hours per pay period. Exempt new hires participate in Cisco’s flexible Vacation Time Off policy, which does not place a defined limit on how much vacation time eligible employees may use, but is subject to availability and some business limitations. All new hires are eligible for Sick Time Off subject to Cisco’s Sick Time Off Policy and will have eighty (80) hours of sick time off provided on their hire date and on January 1st of each year thereafter. Up to 80 hours of unused sick time will be carried forward from one calendar year to the next such that the maximum number of sick time hours an employee may have available is 160 hours. Employees in Illinois have a unique time off program designed specifically with local requirements in mind. All employees also have access to paid time away to deal with critical or emergency issues. We offer additional paid time to volunteer and give back to the community.


Employees on sales plans earn performance-based incentive pay on top of their base salary, which is split between quota and non-quota components. For quota-based incentive pay, Cisco typically pays as follows:


.75% of incentive target for each 1% of revenue attainment up to 50% of quota;


1.5% of incentive target for each 1% of attainment between 50% and 75%;


1% of incentive target for each 1% of attainment between 75% and 100%; and once performance exceeds 100% attainment, incentive rates are at or above 1% for each 1% of attainment with no cap on incentive compensation.


For non-quota-based sales performance elements such as strategic sales objectives, Cisco may pay up to 125% of target. Cisco sales plans do not have a minimum threshold of performance for sales incentive compensation to be paid.

title: Systemingenjör - Systemarkitektur
description:
### **JOB DESCRIPTION**



Har du spetskompetens inom Systems Engineering, med fokus på systemarkitektur, kravhantering och/eller cybersecurity.



I rollen som **Systems Engineer** har du en viktig roll i att omvandla tekniska koncept till innovativa och hållbara lösningar. Du kommer att arbeta mot kunds avdelning som utvecklar och levererar skräddarsydda, kompletta IT-lösningar efter kundens behov och specifikationer.



I din roll arbetar du i projektgrupper genom hela projektets livscykel; från idé till färdig lösning och i nära samarbete med både interna team och externa kunder. I ditt arbete realiserar du systemarkitekturen för att säkerställa att alla systemkomponenter samverkar effektivt i komplexa strukturer och krävande miljöer – med särskilt fokus på IT-infrastruktur och hårdvara. Du arbetar brett med allt från kravanalys och teknisk specifikation till kunddialog och dokumentationsgranskning.

* Skapa och dokumentera systemarkitektur, och säkerställ att systemet uppfyller både tekniska och affärsmässiga krav.

* Utarbeta systembeskrivningar och annan viktig dokumentation för att säkerställa spårbarhet och möta kundkrav


**Välj din inriktning**



Vi söker nu flera personer med olika spetskompetenser inom Systems Engineering.



**Systemarkitektur**



Du fokuserar på att designa och vidareutveckla systemarkitekturen med särskilt fokus på robust IT-hårdvara. Du ansvarar för tekniska vägval, strukturer och dokumentation och ser till att lösningarna är skalbara, återanvändbara och hållbara över tid.

* Erfarenhet som systemingenjör med kunskap inom kravhantering och systemlivscykelprocesser (t.ex. INCOSE, ISO/IEC/IEEE 15288)

* Erfarenhet av system safety eller ILS är meriterande
* Erfarenhet av modellering eller script (t.ex. Python, PowerShell) ses som ett plus
